poWwuROUw_7niGqmlD0mMw.text: ..awesomeeee food ..we didnt expect to much for a$ 10.99 buffet the food was so great..ohh u guys need to come here..

BjHbEyFE7DW-M7Tw0ypWiQ.text: I would rate them 3.5 but decided to round up since the last couple visits were positive. Inexpensive for lunch and decent selection. Good salad bar, tasty brisket and good vegetables. Lots to try and most of it good. Overly generous ice cream server (is that good or bad?) Wait staff very good, with the grand kids and they are free.

cgW1LKAbq8lGrc-LMb2gUw.text: Father's Day 2014  Hubby and I had free buffet coupons so we ended up paying for the kids (12-year-old is considered adult and a 5-year-old), about $29, divided by four = $7/person.   It was Sunday Brunch and the selection was decent. I enjoyed the small portion chicken fried steaks with biscuits and gravy. Salad selection was okay, only iceberg and romaine lettuces. Sushi selection was minimal each time I went back. Maybe my first time at a buffet and not eating sushi :(  I was impressed they had a Mimosa/Champagne Bar with at least seven choices. I didn't bother to ask if it was complimentary or if you had to pay.   The cream puffs were yummy and went well with O's chocolate ice cream--I added some to my filling! Yum! ;p  Good food for a decent price, considering we're not much of buffet eaters.

stlpt6IOB1LLbMmY3z4fDw.text: This review is based on Saturday nights Polynesian buffet. They have it all from Liau to Poke, Tako Poke, Fried oysters which are my favorite, a full pig cooked to perfection with that crispy skin and moist meat below. Bradah this is a place to be for all my Hawaiian friends and family, get your grub on here, you wont regret it. Ofcourse i need to say good luck on saving room for desert lol

aJAiKC7OsxvyYHcd19Gw7A.text: One of the best buffet in vegas. Im a truck driver and visit vegas frequently. Ive notice most buffets in vegas are bland and sometimes up there in price. The seasons buffet is a great deal at $9.99 monday - friday lunch special. The fish tacos are must they are made fresh and taste great. I tried the brisket and it was tender and juicy,well paired with mashed potatoes. They also have made to order pasta with all sorts of sauces. They also have chinese food to chose from. Overall the buffet was delicious with fresh selections to chose from.    Ps: make sure to visit the fish aquarium next to bass pro shop

izgKWoz78NyxtqV0wSJyQQ.text: This buffet is FUN, TASTY, WELL-LAID OUT, HAS A GREAT COLOR SCHEME, ETC! First off, the "Seasons buffet" sign attracts me with it avast array of neon colors! Once I'm in the buffet, lines move fast and I'm seated right away! My family and I have been here a couple of times and each time the variety of food is great! The Italian area has amazing pizzas and pastas, the "American food" section has great potatoes , corn, and fried chicken, and the Mexican food area has great beans, rice, and tacos! The ice cream and pie selection for dessert is amazing! Soft serve is boss! I highly suggest the Seasons buffet at Silverton!

x61LaV5Txd2TxATVKuM11A.text: Seasons Buffet is okay. It's not the best buffet I've ever been to, but it is decent enough that I don't mind coming back here from time to time, especially when a family member has a free buffet coupon to use.  I know it's silly, but I love that Seasons has honey mustard as one of its salad dressing. It's my favorite salad dressing and I don't often see it at other buffets. The food itself is good, nothing fancy or life changing, but good. You can order a plate of custom pasta from the pasta counter which is nice and there's always enough food that I like. There is also plenty of food that looks greasy and unappetizing to me.  The dessert counter is where Seasons Buffet fails though. For as often as I go to Seasons, I find a lot of their cookies and cake slices dry and difficult to eat. Only once did I find a moist cake to eat, their Boston Cream cake, and I was so surprised.  Like I mentioned before, Seasons Buffet is okay. I'd recommend only coming here either if you have a food coupon or it's Polynesian night and you want to spend $19.99 for all you can eat poke.

Lgw_gRS9pYlhe2NYcT5Z5w.text: Not impressed with the buffet.  Food was old even though we arrived as they opened at 4 for dinner.  My husband is very allergic to seafood, and choose a ravioli entree which we thought was cheese, but turned out to be lobster.  Once I tried it I stopped him before he took a bite. Spoke with the chef, and they didn't know what was in the food and the label only said 'chef special'.   Besides the drama this was a huge waste of money.

8AKAgxDIfT0ZY2zdMQ13mw.text: My husband and I decided to give Seasons a try tonight for Polynesian night. Our server (whose name I didn't catch) was very attentive-our plates were cleaned quickly and our drinks were always full. The sushi selection was pretty sparse, but they were all pretty good. The ahi poke tasted like straight onions. I took two bites and tried to make myself like it, but I just couldn't. The teriyaki beef and meatballs were both delicious, as was the suckling pig. It was super juicy! Oh and the chili mint wings and huli huli chicken were awesome! The wings were sweet but spicy-just the right amount of heat! The dessert selection was vast. The little cups were definitely the best. The red velvet cupcake was pretty dry and the frosting on it was oily. Overall we had a pretty good experience, but it was quite a drive for us from Centennial Hills so it may be a while before we make it back.

7D45JFcewoomDacw3AfuWw.text: Nothing really special about this place, it's a small buffet and the buffet is $20+ per person. Aside from that, they didn't let my 8-yr-old get a discount, they charged her as an adult (and my daughter doesnt even eat a lot, shes good with just eating a plate of soup and rice. I literally paid $20+ for soup and rice, where's the justice in that???). The server forgot to refill my husband's drink and we had to call her TWICE for it. Food was ok, it wasnt really that great, they had a few selection. Although their BBQ beef ribs are great. The others just had too much salt, i guess. And im not the type of person who likes salt in food. Not coming back here again, theres a lot of good buffet places here in Vegas that are definitely better and not as overpriced.

Y5JMNJClAtdPI2_xBGF6qA.text: Mediocre buffet food. There was a long ass line to get in so I was hyped up! Like I thought the food was gonna be good! Nope. 10.99 lunch buffet and I feel like home town or freaking Golden Corral is better.

Egjr_5onzpTxlxSh7lOKQQ.text: Came here for Warren P.'s All-Star Lechon UYE and feast on some "Hawaiian inspired" grindz.....The lechon itself was okay...  One of the cooks sliced me of a big honkin' piece of crispy skin, and I saw that no one was touching the pig's feet, so I asked for the ENTIRE front leg/foot :) the top half was very meaty and tasted more like Chinese-style roast pork, but from the kneecap down, it was totally inedible, just bone and tough skin. The ahi and tako poke were good, as was the lomi salmon and the 3 bowls of poi I had.  Dessert was kinda sad...no haupia, and slim pickin' on the rest of the sweets. The company was better than the food.Guess I'll stick to Island Flavor next time I'm in the mood for some Hawaiian grindz....ALOHA!!!  YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(12/365) "Here, piggy piggy!!!"

Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poi, Lomi, Poke, and the ENTIRE pig&#39;s leg:)
Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yelpers ATTACK!!!

jkbWmgxIwbfssM5k4OeCBg.text: Omg. They have everything.  Super clean and super nice. Family and I going back tomorrow before we leave vegas. Great price too. Yummmmmmmmmmy red chili Colorado and their cabbage rolls are great!  Went back the next day. ...still yummy

m1-A2vOdUUerrh-jsBoLXQ.text: I went to the regular Seasons Buffet (Wednesday night 4 - 9pm)....and it wasn't bad!! I liked the beef cut, not sure if it was prime rib but it was a huge chunk of beef that they cut into slices for you.... I liked the chinese food okay, and the salad bar was ok.  I liked the meat when it was freshly put out (for example i kinda had an older piece of bbq pork i didn't like, but my husband got a new piece and it was pretty tender).  I liked the shrimp cocktail because they devein the shrimp, and it's easier to take off the shell.  The shrimp tasted pretty fresh! I've had like a boiled or tough kind of shrimp so this was pretty good.  The dessert wasn't too bad. Overall was pretty good considering we got it for free! We gambled there a couple of times, so Silverton sent us some coupons in the mail for $15 worth of free food, so we got free dinner AND gambled and made some money!  Usually I spend all my money and then some, but today we were kinda lucky on the Wheel of Fortune and the Goldfish game, hooray!  My previous go to affordable vegas buffet was Red Rock, but for some reason I've always felt like really super salty or bloated the next day... so far here at Silverton, the food tastes good and not too overly salty, so I am able to enjoy it more!

BYLGAWTJRXHpNwUsf_WFQA.text: Lets Start With The People Their Are Wonderful (From Cashier-Server). They Even Had Made To Order Pasta And A Cutting Station. It Wasn't The Biggest Buffet I've Ever Went To But Were It Lacked In Size It Had In Quality/Taste Of Food. I Will Defiantly Return For Lunch Again Soon.

t0JpQhXJ3GT5IQqwYRjA8A.text: They've stepped down the quality of their Polynesian Night a bit. They got rid of the tako (octopus) poke and the quality of the roast pig was bad, two of the main reason I go there for.  The roast pig was dry and completely cold, some gelatinous substance was even forming, almost wanted to throw up after eating a few pieces.  The ahi poke, which they do have, is a weird recipe I think they were trying to stretch it out by adding more veggie ingredients.  As always I am a fan because I get to stuff my face with lau lau, kalbi ribs, poi, huli huli chicken, made to order pasta, desserts, kalua pig and cabbage, but now I'm kinda debating if the buffet is worth the $20.99 for the Polynesian Night.  Every first Tuesday they have a buffet from 10:30 pm - 6:30 am for 6.99 because their cafe closes for monthly cleaning.  They close down most of the buffet and offer mostly breakfast items, crepes, sausage links, bacon, etc. They have made to order burgers and omelets which is the only items worth the $6.99.

i9hHhlUMZ3RlKrX6g_mgSA.text: Took some friends to dinner here last night and afterwards felt ashamed for having brought them here. Couldn't stick a fork into the sweet and sour pork. It was hard as a rock. The BBQ pork was almost the texture of jerky. Really disappointed and yet I don't think the management really cares. Will never come back here for dinner.  Mondays fifty percent off for seniors is their only saving grace. For five bucks there's always something to pick out among the offerings to make it worth while. Other than that, you're better off finding a place that's worth $15.00 a plate. This ain't it.

1no6KUj5pmW_hhL9B2kjOw.text: I suggest you go during Saturdays when it is Polynesian night. Unlimited lechon(roasted pork) and poke! It was heaven! They have a ton of dessert choices (pie, cheesecake, ice cream, etc). The line outside was super long and it took us 45 mins to get a seat. I think they need more cashiers up front to hurry up the line. In general, really enjoyed the place. I also liked the steak and the different kinds of seafood. If you have the club card, you can get a free buffet meal when you earn 50 points on the first day, which was a great deal. I wish they had more fruit options and faster seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unlimited pieces of lechon (roasted pork) on saturdays

fdimCtwvUZ5WSYPpLbH4Iw.text: I went for lunch for the first time.  They are only open for lunch and dinner with brunch on the weekends.   My friends had vouchers for $10 free food from swiping their player cards.  They were located in the Silverton Casino in Las Vegas.  The decor was nicely done.  The tables and booths were spacious and it was easy to get to your table.  The selection of food was limited, but presented well.  The taste of the food was average.  The desserts were okay with a few sugar-free options.  I would return only with a food voucher.

kuizZH3LSsFXubwH68m3fg.text: My husband and I loved the atmosphere and the buffet. The food was very fresh unlike some buffets, not over cooked with a great selection. There was no clanging, banging and chatter. We'll be back.

dBO8nh2FtNltfFtKml5PEQ.text: Came here on a Saturday night. Everything was fresh and delicious. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Plenty of types of food to choose from. Didn't have to fight the crowds like you would on the strip.

EvMAnVV8ZiMQC_JxE45spg.text: Say Neigh to the Silverton's Seasons Buffet! I went to the Seasons buffet for Christmas.  The cost was $58.00 for two people.  The food was okay until I had the prime rib.  It had a very gamely flavor.  On closer inspection I realized that there was no marbling and the fat was a very bright yellow.  They were serving horse meat and passing it off as beef!  When I pointed it out to the server, one of the hostesses came over to speak with us.  She offered to bring out the chef, but I told her it was unnecessary.  I had horse meat years before and never forgot the look or taste.  She took our comment card and we saw her throw it away.  We did another and turned it in to the cashiers desk.  Funny thing, as we left we noticed that they had changed out the horse meat prime rib and was now serving beef!

QTnA45I285DLrrObBinsiQ.text: Great buffet lunch great price great food highly recommend the buffet it's $9.99 great deal.

WL8p9wk2vl-xAzEyxXhwgQ.text: The staff was friendly and personable. The food was quality over quantity and I would bring my family and friends here without hesitation as a True local born and raised here in the valley. They are professional and kind from the host/hostess to management. We loved our entire dinning experience.

y_uV5j3CdcAX0fMgVksAJg.text: We had two free buffet passes because we play the slots from time to time. the pizza was good but only cheese peperoini, and vegis to choose from . the green lentil soup was out of sight but out of season. the roast beef was well done i did not par take. the service was good and friendly with promt drink refills. veey welcome to chrildren we have a 1 year old son. the desaert section had a wide selection of pies , but missing mt favorite banna cream. also to my diapointment no sea food to be seen, would i go back, for free yes, if i pay probrly not..

Jcypi-6bSVdNXzPKGxg4zg.text: This buffet is definitely not the best buffet in vegas. For $17 pp I expected better. The choices were not that great. Even the salad bar was not up to par. The prime rib and mash potatoes were the only thing good they had going for them. The build your own pasta bar didn't even have all options available. Save some money and try another buffet. The Rio buffet is a better option, however it is more costly.

kdd66fiITmG4MEhlI7EYxg.text: First let me say I am not really a buffet person. I prefer dining with a choice and I choose one thing and I am good. I do not really like to gorge on too many things. I did hoover between 3 and 4 stars for this place.  I chose 3 due to what happened when we first arrived. At 5:30 on a Saturday there was no line. We walked right p to the cashier. My dad really wanted to go here. Now he has a club card to Silver ton, and I had received a coupon in the mail for a 2 for one buffet so off we went. The cashier tells my dad this is not our card. Rally? it says silvetrton right across the card. Not once did he say your card is outdated, or why do you not go to the club booth and get an updated one , or wait let me call for you. Nope not once ounce of customer service. Honestly I could tell my dad was getting pissed, so I did not even think about running and getting one myself. My dad told the kid forget and paid him. 75.00 for 3 people. I was expecting a huge assortment of food for this amount of money. Honestly there was not that much to chose from. We grabbed some food sat down and I could tell my dad was very upset. He honestly felt disrespected as to how the kid was treating him. and he was not enjoying his 75.00 buffet. We asked our server Gabriel, who by the way was fantastic, to ask a manager to come and talk with us. Gabriel checked back with us to see if she had arrived we told him she had not. We explained what happened and he went to get her again. She did arrive and I told her what happened. She asked for my dad's card ,saw it was outdated, asked my dad to go with her to the club booth, she got him a new card then honored the coupon. Which of course was the right thing to d. My dad seemed relieved after this and really liked the manager and that she treated him with respect and not as an old man. We finished our meal, found Gabriel gave him a generous tip and were on our way.  Now I will say the food we had was very good. The desserts far too sweet. And our server needs a huge promotion!.  Will we go back probably not. I still think it is too pricey.

BYEi18bdr12bWqSytZ5oPg.text: Went for the breakfast buffet which was pretty affordable but the food was below expectations. The meat was probably the best part of the buffet, for the price we paid. Everything else - the pasta, cooked food, even the drinks - were bad. Though there was a large selection of desserts, most were terrible (between my friends and I, we tried many). The lemon meringue was particularly poisonous.

8bwPYmWJMvsL7JdOi4dXDQ.text: I came here on Mothers Day with 5 friends & 3 kiddos. They had a speciall of $5 for the buffet. So it was pretty packed. We finally got in after an hour wait. Thankfully our server was good and took our drink orders fast. We were pretty thirsty. LOL The prime rib was really good and so were the stuffed crabs. For another $5 bucks it was all you can drink sangria. So of course I had to try to get my moneys worth on that. It's always fun to be a drunk mommy on mothers day! So all in all it was 35 bucks for 9 people..2 of which were free since they are toddlers. I don't think you can do any better than that on a holiday. I will come back for a deal like that anytime.

QS48xtXeLR6O0ooLUfkBgA.text: This buffet is never a disappointment. It seems that we always wind up there in the middle of the week and there is almost no line. The food is always tasty and the selection is pretty good. They have a nice desert bar. The price isn't bad at $13.99 with your players card. You can't beat $5 all you can drink beer.

pplVEkfUnw-m0mfh7ltGBQ.text: We wanted to try the polanisian buffet  there were a few good options but overall your typical buffet joint.One positive was that we got 2 buffets for free after signing up a players card.It will be a long time before I go to a buffet joint again!

k3YwSsPmmOJjg9ncDxlLDg.text: One of the better locals Buffets.  Too bad the line is always so long.  The deserts used to be better but the rest of the food is still good.  You won't go wrong eating here.

kz_ss1Dpo848R14iZ1DuDA.text: This is honestly one of my favorite buffets in Vegas. It is so worth it! I believe its about $22/pp and sometimes its buy one get one free. Also if you sign up for the Silverton Casino players club you can also get a discount. Come early for dinner because sometimes theres a pretty long wait.   The buffet has a good variety of food. There's different themes through out the week. But one thing I must say about this buffet is that the crab legs are great. Theyre pretty fresh in my opinion and they also serve them hot. You just have to ask the ppl in the back to get it for you. The staff there is pretty nice. I always enjoy going to this buffet.

3wPx9DNROXAfgCbcijJ8JQ.text: This place is nice! I love the lodge feeling and they hit it here dead on. There's a really cool water feature in the front, that looks like water is running down logs stacked on each other, only it's made of copper, or at least that's the color.   We had a team meeting here. We came during not-so-busy hours and it was really nice. The food was good, and the gelato bar is really cool, but my favorite part is really the feel you get from their interior design. Very comfy, very "lodgy". :)

etipksxGWvvzUlaudQHCrg.text: For a cheap place, it has good quality food. Like most buffets, you find your favorites. I love the sausage and the strawberry ice cream!!!   My advice is come here if you want to save money and eat a decent buffet. If you want to spend more then go to a buffet on the Strip.

9BQ2mWcDqvZ_1EeQ1AnhxA.text: This is the very first buffet in Vegas we ate at.  Honestly, considering the line of people, I was expecting the food to be out of this world.  It was okay, but Luby's Cafeteria honestly has better food in my opinion.  The reason why we will go back is the $5 unlimited wine and beer special.  You pay once and drink as much as you want!  That's excellent.

F90QOTrwDEN7RcNK69YY-A.text: We went to the Polynesian night buffet, it is pretty good they had lau lau( pork , a little butterfish wrapped in taro leaves then wrapped again in ti leaves and steamed for a few hrs ) it was small but u can eat all u want.  They also had a whole roasted pig, tako poke, ahi poke , kalua pig, sushi , huli huli chix, kal bi and poi about $20 it was worth it to me. I don't think even in Hawaii u can eat like that for 20 bucks or so.  I will b back .

f1dQO2mhfDGwVKfNIs4_hg.text: Huge selection. Reasonable price. Something for everyone. Especially love the bellini brunch.

xtBn1kcd3Or15XOh2pS5Cg.text: Went here the last time I was in Vegas, and it's a great place to go. Even better since we signed up for a Player's Club card, so we had free buffet tickets. Very good food and wide variety of selections. The Prime Rib and crab legs were especially good. I think that's what Vegas is all about- the food!

mWpGjCIO5d_h3VgVFKDzIg.text: Friday night Seafood Buffet at this local's buffetis is very good. Hot and cold crab stations with plenty of other excellent choices. The clam chowder was mislabeled as Manhatten instead of New England so it's good that I am nosy, it was great. The desert selection was a bit sparse but adequate. It's been awhile since I've visited the Silverton, it won't be as long until next time.  I have to admit that I had a twofer from the Las Vegas Advisor so it tasted even better at half the $23.95 regular price.

8ZaOH565xIFJ8ujPPmlHBQ.text: At the price point, this is a solid locals buffet. It is very comparable in quality and pricing to the Feast Buffets at GVR and Red Rock, which are the feature buffets for the Station Casinos properties. Like you should do at any buffet, it's important to do a full assessment of the food offerings before choosing anything. Once you've analyzed the situation, then you can make well reasoned food choices and pace yourself as necessary. There always ends up being a few items that catch my eyes and allow me to leave full upon completion. A plus is that coupons for 50% off a buffet come regularly in the mail, which make the buffet an especially good deal. Since it's the closest casino to my house and the coupons keep arriving, I'll continue to come.

MxC7uakraOPUkYza6G0vyg.text: Enjoyed the Polynesian themed buffet on Saturday night.  Great food at a great value.    Poke, roasted pig, banana leaf pork - I was back in Hawaii.    Not a big fan of the dessert, but didn't mind - I really had no room for it.

hpCuCHIb8kk2KTnhUtq54w.text: Went for Sunday Brunch & was impressed by how quick we were seated. The food selection was great. Plus, they had complimentary mimosas in various flavors, which were yummy (the Sunrise & Raspberry ones where my favs). Will definitely stop by for brunch here again when I'm back in Vegas.

yPWbnfNvdclxIpAdHG-J_g.text: Beautiful decor, excellent service, great food variety and decent quality. This is my go-to buffet when I visit Las Vegas. The mac and cheese, fried rice, pizza, grilled salmon, cake and cookies were all delicious. The fried fish and shrimp however were bland. I used a buy one get one free buffet coupon provided by Grandview Las Vegas and that saved me and my husband about 20 dollars on Friday. Beware! They don't accept the coupon directly at the buffet. You have to go to the player's club, get a player's card and then they apply the coupon to your account. Next you go to a promotion kiosk and print out their version of the same coupon which you take to the buffet. We were not informed of this beforehand and had to make 2 trips back and forth from the buffet to the player's club due to the misunderstanding. Not cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza, mac and cheese and fried rice
Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried fish, fried shrimp, mac and cheese, string beans with garlic sauce and fried rice

EPbjuX7ryFKPCB3UM-bkrw.text: The lunch buffet here is one of the best deals in Las Vegas. I love that the Silverton hotel and casino is way off the strip, away from the crowds. For under $22, my husband and I enjoyed a delicious lunch buffet with many options for food and desserts.

B78izhByEmV7vvDxDa7wJg.text: Came for the seafood buffet the most expensive day at the buffet--if u  r not here when they open for dinner ---- don't go in and waist your money ... save yourself the over priced charge or the time that when they replenish and the trays get empty in 2 minuets! the trays are left  often with leftovers no food almost as empty  for long time  You will leave unhappy angry and hungry!!!!  Shame on the management of the restaurant and the hotel

qMnEsm_SC6EH359CFJ3WAg.text: This Place is Worth the 21.99. They can take my money anytime! They have they huge lechon, peppered pork, the pork wrapped in banana leaves was amazing! The chili wings were delicious.  The prime rib was medium rare, talk about yum! Everything was perfectly seasoned. The desserts are amazing. Try the Spumoni! This place has a huge Asian selection and they have an Italian station. The line gets long but that's most buffets in Vegas. I like that the casino doesn't smell like an ashtray. They really keep this place clean.

GymQP6SbV1H9pZ4hArakag.text: Decided to go here for brunch.  We were seated rather quickly. The food was plentiful and delicious.  The service by the wait staff was warm, courteous and welcoming. The price of the buffet was what we expected and we were quite pleased.  If you are in Vegas and are staying around the Silverton hotel area it is a definite place to enjoy a buffet meal.

0BSLTuHCSobCdAgiK0Ukfg.text: First time here, loved the food and service. Asian station had best food and fish tacos were awesome! Actually all the preparations were great. Hot food was hot and cold was cold. While you are here, don't forget to check out the mermaids at the aquarium. There is seating around the aquarium so we really enjoyed observing marine life. First time club members get 50% off the bill with max of $50 off if you have a large group. So very worth getting it.

zBazw7Mr1b_DBH2WftXh2g.text: We've never been to the Barbecue night. It was very good. Delicious wonton soup, well everything was good & we would come again on this night

l7m5teVJeTsZ4ohlTlp5jg.text: Ending up here due to all major casinos on the strip had over 2 hour waits.    This place tries very hard for a 4 star rating and comes very close.   Here are the issues.    1.  No crab legs.  Have not had them at this buffet for over 4 years.   Bring them back!  Crab legs are a buffet staple.    2.  Salty.  Lots of great flavors going on, but many of the dishes are too salty.    The selection is decent.  Enough for a variety of palates.   The service was great.  Quick to clear plates at your table.    Overall, this place is more than decent.   It saved our group long waits, so for that I was grateful. I can easily recommend.   Enjoy

M5qh5b3zGe-j56JRdm9nUQ.text: Not bad, Actually I like it. I went lunch there.  Decent price with ok food.  I like their desert selection.    Just  my impression though, some employee shows "White first"-ish attitide.   At the casher, there was 2 suite lady working.  No line at all.  A white gentleman entered just a minites in front of us was nicely and promptly greeted and seated.  As we come, the cashier staffs are talking each other for a while letting us wait for them to finish up their coversagion.  Greeting was lazy and dull too. Well, I was uncomfortable and unpleasant to.

9djV1t-M7Xuzcp9_VZ6umg.text: To the wonderful head chef of the Hawaiian buffet, hey brah how's about adding ono curry chicken katsu to the menu?  Awesome job everyone!!!

P-SzJBx-zIMmQFlmNNU1UA.text: Dear Director of Food and Beverage,  I wanted to write you to let you know we had the most amazing time at your Buffet. The food was good but the service was Excellent! Our server, Annette, ran circles around the other waitress. We never had an empty glass nor was there ever a dirty plate on our table. I will be back and I hope to have her as my server again!!

dthE4gk6Cl2i3s0NFJwRzg.text: I came to Seasons buffet at the Silverton Hotel to meet up one of my BFF's and her fiance for dinner.   We stood in line and got a table for 5. They soon came after. I was impressed at how nice this buffet was. Food was actually good. As I mentioned before, I'm not a buffet type of person but I liked what they served. I saw that they had the traditional Hawaiian food such as lau lau, chicken long rice, and pork. Mostly known as lechon to the Filipino community. Yum! The lechon was good and tender. Skin was crunchy. I also had fried rice, cream cheese wontons, and the noodles. Finally a place with noodles which I was craving earlier. The waiter was good about refilling our drinks. The cream cheese wontons were huge and had a good sized amount of cheese. I wish I could have taken more pictures but I got caught up in the food and conversation with my BFF and her fiance.   For dessert, I got the sugar free desserts. Trying to watch my sugars. I got a small sugar free cheesecake and a small sugar free fruit tart. So good. Cheesecake tasted smooth and fresh. They also had the regular desserts such as fudge, red velvet cake and so much more. Wish I could have had more but I was already full.   The buffet was pretty pricey. It was $19.99 with the Silverton card and $21.99 without the card. Kids under 4 eat free! That's even great for my daughter. This was definitely worth trying. Highly recommend!

Puu4Lzgu-8YimnV1EhW3xg.text: Don't do it! This place sucks during brunch/lunch hours. Not that many selections and when I mean not that many selections...it's very little selections. I hated it. Of course my kids are simple...pizza and spaghetti. I'm very disappointed. I will not be back, I would be better off at the New Orleans buffet. Same price better selections and more!

Rr8e1hzhajr0mSu-eiTMFA.text: Eaten here three times now.  I like the carving station the best.  The meats are always tasteful.  Last time, I went back three times!  All the other foods are alright and the desserts are good.  Service has always been excellent.  I've eaten the Saturday night Polynesian and it's good also.

3ZUzMxkwYWs0mAJGZdDs_A.text: Excited to try out Polynesian food, so we came to this Seasons. Some online reviews says it is ok and some like it. First impression with no queue is not a good impression. Turns out to be the worst buffet ever tasted. Poke is terrible and not well presented. The roast pig was a big chunk of mess turn over several times by people. Best food was the custom order Italian Shrimp Scampi pasta ..... non Polynesian food. Disappointing buffet!

fJDSFMOcRRq7U7E928vdVw.text: We ate here on Christmas $25.99 a little pricey but they served lamb they fell off the bone. That alone was worth it. Annette our server was so sweet and very attentive! Her service alone was enough for us to come back the next day.

-HeRYlot51Z2gRB5uG4Dvg.text: Saturday night Polynesian buffet is as close to home as you can get if you live CONUS!  Lau lau, lomi salmon, poi, kalua pig, suckling roast pig (with crispy skin), poke, and a whole lot of other stuff!  Come early (there's always a line) and come hungry!

_hijTCzZFymL8IfBWMeTRQ.text: I think I can say that this buffet is my favorite buffet out there. The Sunday Brunch is great and all the food is excellent. They have a huge spread of food ranging from Breakfast(french toast) to lunch(smoked salmon). They have 4 different Mimosa's to choose from and the price is worth every bit of food.   The waiters and waitresses are pretty good about filling your coffee and clearing plates after your done eating. I think because I never have a bad experience here I will bump their rating up one more star.

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i3p0bC0_MkjfZazJZIXoZQ.text: Moved here 8 months ago and we have eat at all the major Casino Buffets.. Most really are disappointing and expensive.. I finally got to eat here today and the food was just unbelievably good, bordering on Great!, The staff was very friendly, the process was a Bargain and $9.99 with you player card..   I love the decor. the hugh aquarium and pleasant table games and dealers.. I really was very impressed with the entire location and the Bass Pro Shop next door.   I promise you, give it a try.. you will be very surprised how nice it is there..

haPGCck3Atd-E-01oMf1Lw.text: I saw the reviews which were 50/50 but my family and I LOVED it. It was smaller than some but the food was really good! The desserts were amazing! They had every kind of cake and pie, great choices of ice cream and even a sorbet; cheesecake, red velvet cake and pound cake!  From The salad station to every station, Italian, Asian, Mexican and things in between. For $16 it was definitely great! We loved the very flavorful pizza, great bok choy, excellent chili Colorado, chicken seemed to be rotisserie, Mac n cheese taste like it came from the dirty, dirty south....YUM! We didn't expect much with the reviews so maybe that's why we're soooooo impressed! For a family of 5, it was well worth the BOGO deal! Also our server Annette was working hard and just a gem! Thank you Annette!

UcwbFPJkQfpUpJNVt5-WYA.text: Very good,  with a terrific assortment.  Get the players card if you don't already have one. The discounts very but it's worth something toward a  better priced  buffet.

uwGbRYPLIYGRKo51F47Bxg.text: An all time favorite buffet for breakfast, lunch, or dinner for the locals. Sign up for the players card for extra savings. The food there is excellent, with many serving stations.The lines into the buffet can be long, so get there early. This is a great place to go for holidays, or for any occasion to share with family and friends. The staff is always friendly, and you will love the desserts!

CkkOlm0PNUfv5XVBh06vcw.text: Ok,  So I know what your thinking 5 stars really?? But I'm here to tell you they are indeed worth the 5 stars I gave them.. Listen people if you want the Balligo then GO THERE.. But you if want something reasonable and actually good then come here.. We went during lunch and luckily got in right before it bacame packed and yes it was buy one get one half off or free..  Trust me it was a great time all the food was seasoned good and there was something for everyone and trust me I'm kind of a picky eater some would say, but I loved the choices they had .. The staff was friendly and so was the manger that was there making sure everyone was seated and that the food was hot and ready.. And she spoke to everyone .. I get some of you have a bad time time at this place and I'm sorry about that but for I can say from my visit there I had a great time, service was good and the food was great.. I will def. will come back again maybe next time for Dinner..  See you there..

EDDwhuTcuXNNQpLK3n_nHw.text: Maybe I am just sick of buffets, but this one just does not have any appealing attributes. The large room is understaffed. I was watching our server running between 15 different tables. There was no time for guest service other than get them their drinks and clear tables. It took 10 minutes before we saw our server because he was swamped.   The food quality is substandard fare. The salad bar was one of my favorite stations because it had roasted beets. There wasn't anything special, but it was consistent and well kept. The shrimp cocktail were not bad either. Other than that, I would skip everything else.   Food stations ran short on a few occasions. Finding a plate, or some ramekins were near impossible.

FXhaKHSC4ntlznhwP_XvhA.text: We've been here twice this week & we were so pleased to have so many selections & great desserts. We even took friends there tonight. Great value for $

bFuksMCg6rUNjdILRdB6NA.text: I visited on a Sunday evening on my way home from the airport. I was cool to be in the same location as the bass pro shops. They charged me 17.99 for the buffet. It was about. 7:15 pm. The place was maybe half full.  The food selection was I thought very limited.  The Asian area had noodles and fried rice. Lemon chicken which was very dry and over cooked. There was 3 soups. The egg drop was Luke warm. Didn't finish my bowl. The crab wonton were so over done. I took 4 and only ate one. This is usually one of my favorite.  Moved over to try the Italian area. Tried the stuffed manicotti which I thought was good. I should have put more sauce over them  a bit that was my bad. The clam chowder was very good.  They had fried catfish nuggets and planks. They were good.    I had a slice of pizza and it was really tasty.  The desert table was delicious. I ate 3 different cup cakes. They were moist and delicious.  I really wanted to try this place,which I am glad I did , but I don't think I would go back or recommend this place. There are several other restaurants located there and you may save a little bit of money and get better food.

BNVHgRs_McirrIiTMUvilQ.text: August 12, 2011  This buffet is amazing!  I would have gave this place a 5 star rating if it weren't for the ridiculously long line and grumpy lady at the dessert counter.  Aside from that.. superb and highly recommended!  Pros:   +  The best Prime Rib I have ever feasted on   +  Inviting ambiance with spacious seating   +  steamed crab w/ the option to toss in flavors  Cons:   -  Lines are way too long    Okay, let me start off with the negative...  I met my girlfriend at Silverton since I was coming from work.  My girlfriend arrived at 4:30pm.  I arrived at near 5:00pm and we didn't get to our table until 6:15pm!  That's ridiculous!  Friday is Seafood day (which is the day we went) and starts at 4pm.  I was starving by the time we got in (good considering I was about to devour AYCE style).  Dinner on Friday Seafood night is $22.99 with your Silverton card.  This is a good price in comparison to the likes of Wynn and the M buffet.  I hated the wait, but was really surprised at the quality of the food.  The service was really good too aside from a grumpy worker in the dessert section.    Overall:   I would highly recommend this buffet to people.  This is overall the best buffet I have ever been to.  The quality, price, and service combined makes this an awesome experience.    Tips: *  Different days have different specials: Friday Dinner is Seafood Night Thursday Dinner is Polynesian Night (Hawaiian) Tuesday Dinner is Cowboy Night (BBQ)  (I'm not too sure about Tuesday being Cowboy night.. Call first if you are interested in this one.  *  Try the Prime Rib....AMAZING!  *  The crab laid out is cold crab.  If you want boiled crab, you have to ask for it.   *  Don't forget to get your crab sauteed in flavor. I got Garlic butter YUM!  *  Save room for dessert: a selection of sugar-free desserts.  I'd recommend the Cappuccino Ice Cream (this one isn't sugar-free).  *  Show up early to avoid the wait in line.    * Sign up for the Player's card for free buffet at Silverton.    *  Lunch hours end at 3pm and Dinner starts at 4pm.

4RwtLeppD4IF2ij_3sB1Sw.text: Silverton's Saturday Polynesian Buffet has all the entrees any Hawaiian would crave for. Don't let Polynesian fool you, because it really is Hawaiian. Their food stations stretch out across the whole dining room wall. I loved their poke, tako poke, kim chee, laulau, poi, kalua pig, and desserts. The tako poke and kim chee were so spicy HOT, after my first bite my tongue was numb. For all that's available the price is very reasonable. Sure did satisfy my 'opu. Mahalo nui Silverton.

Jn-2ddE_qiYysDrluSpyXQ.text: I was surprised by the low rating this place received.  My husband and I thought the selections were impressive for an off the strip casino.  The price was very reasonable and everything we tried tasted good.  We'll be back.

dZArAND0KBLd8l6_HYa9PQ.text: On Wednesday night my wife and I have now eaten here 3 times and each time it improves. Clean environment, drinks are served quickly, food is above average. It's a big and fun location and the Price is Right! My favorite was the Asian cuisine and mint and chip ice cream!!

f0gA6JH8LIb3JQFEzssV-w.text: This is one Buffet that we love to go to mainly because of the Great food and fantastic service not mention the excellent ambience

7VhrHUY8b8mE62hSQrJslA.text: Usually this buffet is not too bad.  On this visit, I got about a two inch worm like parasite in the crab legs (picture posted).  I was told that "it happens" and that I should look at it like a chicken bone and not eat it.  Don't eat it??  No shit!

-wTFAx3Uz9sIrWxIDk1GHw.text: First off....  Show up early... THERE CAN BE A HUGE LINE!!!!  and during specific hours...  you can be waiting for awhile!!!!  It is pretty big and there are alot of sitting booths.  After that, you have a huge selection of food to choose from... I think I ate alot of  salad and chicken, shrimp and desserts...   the staff i had were very friendly and took away our dirty dishes.  Price is moderate for a full on buffet.

P9NfFGP-Pp61N3radKaRTw.text: Came here for Belini brunch. It was my first time here and I will definitely be returning. All of food was fresh and good! The price was very good. Service was excellent!

iDfv5ya0EDKqfDl3q1zFzQ.text: One of the worst buffets ever. Everything (chicken, salmon, potatoes, sausage) was extremely dry. Food tasted as though it had been sitting out for hours. If you like home town buffet you'll like this place. YUCK!!!!!

WXNsuSQt0TcYQNXRV8zUvQ.text: The only reason to eat at this buffet is because you are given a food credit or a free buffet coupon.  It is just ok...but most if not all the food is just out of a can.  Hint...try the pasta bar for fresh watch it be made pasta.  Ask for shrimp as it is behind the counter.  Never pay full price and you will be a happy camper!

CNzeQrgfYu1YnIPgzFAS_w.text: Kind of disappointed. We did a search for seafood buffets and the silverton popped up. What a joke. Fish tacos with tilapia and dinky little pieces of dried out catfish. The rest of the food was hit or miss. In my opinion the crate your own pasta bar was the best option they had. Nice atmosphere, and the staff was okay. Helpful,but nothing to swoon over.  I was kind of shocked because I've been to other casinos with a WAY bigger selection. Wait. Im eating the icecream now and it is fantastic. I have changed my mind about the pasta being the best part.

5DtIVkp3LurUO0gCWjshXQ.text: The Sunday brunch is disappointing! They don't have crab legs or lamb! Everything pretty much tasteless. Definitely not coming back here. Eggs Benedict eggs are not cooked all the way. See in picture. The egg whites are not cooked.  Soggy waffles, hard french toast, weak coffee, and staff acted like we were bothering them when asking for more drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is there under done eggs benedict. When I informed the manager he was very rude and brush me off.

2PQcIFOI_ECTozvaAM4-mw.text: Went for brunch for the third time here and it was the best it's ever been. Simply because of their crab legs. I mean, damn. So good. I like the ones you have to break with your hands. It's more fun to me! Yeah you have to work a little bit more, but at least you don't have crab falling out of its shell like aria and cosmos Buffet. The other two times I've been here, the crab sucked. Plain and simple, it was smaller - harder to snap and it tasted terrible. Now it's totally different!  You have 4 options on the crab. Cold, steamed, Cajun sauteed, or Garlic sauteed. Both sauteed were delicious!  Another part of this buffet that I enjoyed was the Asian section, the chicken dish and beef noodle dish was great. And the pizza was really good. I think this is one of the best buffets because of the food but how can you beat the price??? $17.99, for free champagne too?!? One of the best buffets for the money in Vegas!

kgSB2anNSZfyC7fuEPxYJA.text: We've been to the Saturday champagne brunch twice.  Really good food, and a champagne bar where you walk up yourself and can get all of the glasses of champagne you want in several different flavors (raspberry...yum).  For the price ($18 per person), you can't beat this brunch.  Ask for Annette as your server -- she's FABULOUS and will make your experience the best!

vqbaQKb7yMY1ueM_BpCEIw.text: Had the Sunday Brunch at Seasons and the only item I liked were the white chocolate covered strawberries and eggs that were freshly cooked.  The bacon, potatoes and sausage were soo greasy I could not eat them.  Went for waffles and they were sooo dry and cold could not eat those  either.  Then went for pastries and tried pecan pie...just awful  and finally settled for the strawberries which were delicious.  My husband agreed but $39 was a lot of money to spend for eggs and strawberries!!!

6D4VVI6HbHZAYd07CTHHbg.text: First of all I hate buffets! So I was so surprised when I took my family to the Silverton buffet as a last minute surprise... The food here was absolutely amazing! The food here is better than most casinos in Las Vegas including the so called best buffets at the Green Valley Ranch and at the Palms Casino so on and so forth... I highly recommend this buffet to everyone to come down and try not only is the food good but the prices are absolutely amazing I took in I think it was 45 people for under 50 bucks! Now you can't beat that for a Vegas buffet!!! I have no complaints whatsoever only a strong recommendation to go try it yourself!

0roFOyJMaFvSD8Ceh89YRw.text: Love the BOGO buffet offered to player card members, butttttt can they possibly find away to get people inside & seated faster than a snails race!!???? "They" know it's going to be extra busy during their BOGO days so why not prepare and speed it up!! Waiting in a 45 minute line of around maybe 20 people isn't worth it.

nHEk9-jE98ibFv05L2DEpQ.text: I can't really complain about a $6.99 breakfast buffet that turned into brunch shortly after we were seated ;)  For breakfast they had bacon, sausages, scrambled eggs, biscuits with country gravy, french toast, granola, oatmeal, country fried steak, potatoes Au Gratin, and a "make your own omelet" section. The country gravy was probably the best I've ever had! Not too thick and it was just oozing with flavor. It was so good we even poured it over our omelets. We went back to the buffet for breakfast seconds and that's when we noticed the whole other half of the buffet was now open for the lunch selection. They had an Asian food section with chow mein, orange chicken,broccoli Beef, egg drop soup, wonton soup, and fried rice; An Italian section with pizzas, pastas, and I believe they were opening up a "build your own pasta" section because I read some sign that read: First, choose your own sauce. And the salad bar with a few choices of soup. Since I was already kind of full from my first plate, I just got a bowl of tomato soup, which was very tasty. Don got a giant piece of brisket, which he described as "ok," but within a few minutes the whole piece was nonexistent. Before we left, I checked out the dessert section which included assorted pies/cakes, gelato, gingerbread cookies, and breakfast pastries. I went with the gingerbread man because I was feeling a little festive. I only ate off his head, but it was nice and soft ;)  Tip *They no longer have the $6.99 holiday buffet since it only ran for about 5 days. THey only have a weekend brunch, but it's $17.99

NmFhbiOgwDjLGyuOJF9j7w.text: I've been coming here for years but just found out they don't have crab legs anymore. They stopped a year ago. Thats why this place is empty during a packed weekend in Vegas.

RyoFKRc3NISzaVTyzuXEaA.text: If you're in Vegas and looking for a buffet definitely stop by Seasons at Silverton Casino. This place was great! It's a few miles away from the strip so you'll have to drive/taxi, but certainly worth it. The have a great selection of items at the buffet; from traditional american to asian & mexican selections. The food was good quality & fresh and not lacking flavor, like many buffets do. The price was also reasonable. $16.99 without a coupon and it includes beverages (soft drinks), with an option to purchase alcoholic beverages for an additional cost. We have absolutely no complaints about the food. And I wish I could rate 4.5 stars instead of 4. The only critique I have is that they make it kind of hard to locate spoons (for soup, ice cream, etc.). And also, our waitress didn't come around as much as we would've liked for drink refills. We had to track her down once, which wouldn't have been a problem if the place was super busy, but it wasn't. Overall...very good! I would definitely come back!

kXaOUJ8-ttWcJex6rLBL3A.text: Silverton's buffet is definitely a player in the Vegas buffet competition. The decor, like the entire resort, is a natural / outdoors meets indoors. Very pretty. The food was good. We went for lunch. Our buffet was comped because we joined and played in the Silverton Player's Club. The service was good more "help yourself" as opposed to what you'd experience say at the Mirage. However, I did notice the lunch buffet was only around 10.00 as opposed to the mega strip resorts being around 24.00 for lunch. I did not see what dinner cost was. The food was delicious and good quality. Overall the buffet was about half the size of the Mirage but remember you are paying half the price of the Mirage. I had the brisket and it was delicious! I also thought their traditional take on classics like pecan pie, cobbler, etc were awesome. They even had a sugar free section of desserts.

bbUs_UfM5VcR14Gktv7xzA.text: Very subpar. Dessert is good (chocolate cake and fruit tart) but the rest is meh. Kind of worried that I will get worms or sick from the tuna poke.

zL2dgkrTDefIz6Cii__MEw.text: I've been here so many times it's like going to my home kitchen.  Some days the food is great like during the Polynesian Buffet. Other days it's hit or miss. One thing that I can always count on is the pasta station. Check out the Buffet I'm sure you can something to enjoy.

WBXqnxQCy0ZpOCf9vguL3w.text: Polynesian night I enjoyed the made-to-order pene pasta with clams and pesto - pasta is probably available every night. Very hard to figure out the available choices. I also enjoyed some of the whole pig - probably only available on Polynesian night. The kalua pig was good.  The prime rib was tough, dry (even mid-rare), and full of gristle. How can a kitchen ruin prime rib? A lot of items look to be "take from freezer, heat, put out." Mostly, I found myself trying a couple bites before leaving it on the plate in hopes of finding something good.  Ice cream was soft and airy - not smooth and creamy. The pies were almost tasteless.   People behind the buffet counter looked exhausted and completely unhappy to be there. While not busy (first clue at 7:30 on Saturday night), I waited 30 - 120 seconds before getting the attention from a worker at the pasta and prime rib stations.  $55 for two with tip, so very expensive for what you get.

f7aki3lFc7ywFrizfOd_0w.text: came here only for Polynesian Saturday's and they never fail to satisfy.   21.99 for non-members, 19.99 if you are.   Still a great deal!

N3BAPLR0XTXh528ekBbBog.text: Warning.  We decided to try the buffet here.  Never again.  Service was great. The main entrees were terrible.  The beef too tough, asian vegetables did not have the right fresh flavor.  The hot and sour soup again did not have the right flavor.  The corn on the cob was frozen not fresh.  We tried a little of everything and I have to say better off going to a restaurant.  The only great taste was the desserts.  My husband was to going to the bathroom at 2:00 in the morning because of the food and I was sick to my stomach and didn't get to sleep until 2:00 in the morning.  HERE IS YOUR WARNING.

-SgALZ6Njybl7ivpgul6qA.text: Not bad. I've been to Las Vegas tons of times, and found this buffet to be quite decent. I think I liked it even more since it's a seafood buffet, and I love seafood! They had a fair amount of choices available, from shrimp ceviche to pad thai. They also had meat options, which was pretty cool. One of my favorite things to eat was their king crab legs -- they give you these neat little tools to open the crab legs, and man, there was a lot of meat inside! The cocktail shrimp was good as well. If you're a bread-lover, they've got some great raspberry bread! Surprisingly tasty!  As for dessert, I'll admit their selection wasn't great, but it wasn't totally lacking. They had some good ice cream that wasn't too frozen nor too melted, which is how I like it. They also offered waffle cones for the ice cream! Bonus points!  One of the things I was impressed with at the buffet was their service. Our waiter was constantly available and always refilled our drinks -- even without us asking! At one point I gave my sister some of my iced tea (I poured it into her empty glass) and he even refilled that drink with iced tea even though she hadn't ordered iced tea to begin with!  Overall, I'd come here again -- I had a decent experience and pretty good food. Left without having a heavy feeling in my stomach and a food coma, yet I was extremely satisfied. If you want to stop at a buffet and have a seafood craving, this isn't a bad place to chow down!  By the way, the decoration is quite nice and the place is very clean and spacious!

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7URpdWXtIOKbRAIVEnkPpQ.text: This review is specially for the Polynesian/Hawaiian themed night which runs for dinner on Saturdays. First off, one should be aware that the special dinner nights (Friday and Saturday) are slightly higher in cost (19.99 versus 13.99 on Sun - Thurs with player's card discount). But boy, what a spread this is! And all you really need to do is look around and see Hawaiians everywhere to know that this is the place to be for an awesome Saturday night buffet. I'm sort of a neophyte when it comes to this style of food but with the vast selections of seafood (no crab legs though) and even sushi, this was a good deal. And since we were able to use a 2 for 1 coupon, it quickly became a great deal! I'd eventually like to come back to see what this buffet is like on a non themed night but judging from the great ambiance and high quality, I'm not the least bit concerned about leaving disappointed.

1lOHXwtujZDNoAhpobpqrA.text: First, let me explain my star-rating if I may..   NO buffet, not even the M Buffet will ever get 5 stars. Why? BECAUSE IT'S A BUFFET, that's why. Let's be real here folks, buffets are glorified cafeteria food, the same food if not a slight grade above employee dining food. So when we're talking buffet ratings, a 4 star deal, in my opinion would be the MAX.   When the stress of the day along with record temperatures leave my brain fried, I tend to not be in the market for even the most minor decision making. Though I am not a huge fan of group troff dining, it seems to be the best bet when undecided is the verdict for where and what to eat for dinner.   If you are not starving when you first arrive at the Silverton, have no fear, the hour wait just to be seated (even on a Wednesday) will have your stomach growling by the time your butt hits the seat.   Salad, soup are your usual suspects at any buffet along with the dessert station. But the Italian cuisine was delicious and not your typical spaghetti and pizza, they threw in some rolled eggplant, and fried raviolis, yum! The Asian area was pretty decent..well the noodles were good, the fried rice tasted like Mexican rice to me, which worked out considering they didn't have a Spanish themed station at all there! (weird).   The carving station: WOW, I'm not sure what sort of animal they slaughtered for the "prime rib" but it could very well have been a dinosaur. I've never seen a bone-in hunk of meat so large in my life. Since I'm not a meat eater this made my stomach turn and I quickly sprinted past the station to some more animal friendly choices.. such as mac and cheese (yum) and some fried fish.   Dessert was decent. I was pleasantly surprised that I did not have to peel a crunchy layer back from anything I tasted, it was all sliced and served fresh! Best part was cheesecake and ice cream (chocolate chip mint), worst, the pumpkin pie (ick!).   All in all, was it worth the wait.. sure, almost anythings worth the wait when your starving, ha ha. Would I eat there again, sure, why not.   Undecided on where to eat? Try the Silverton Buffet

iKDWfLSwfwJnCX7xEnV8vw.text: Never a disapointment. A well kept secret for those in the know. Check out the various specialty nights on their website. Monday all day $5.00 for Seniors. Always good quality ingredients. Haven't been disapointed yet and they serve Starbucks

54yjGwBulCnozac5IWVpCA.text: I went and ate there with my family! For Fathers day brunch, it was the best... Yummy fried oyster, crab legs you can have your crab legs cold or hot dip in boiling Cajun spice or garlic butter... It was gooood, champagne are served with our choice of syrup ( passion fruit, mango, raspberry, mimosa or Just plain). Chinese, Italian, American and even the dessert was great.. Great price and worthed.  Loved it

7hOGDmypyQfloepOE8L_3Q.text: This was my first buffet in Vegas so I was expecting a lot more. It was okay but nothing spectacular. The price was fair. But the food bland and the salad bar needed more fresh fruit. I went doing on a Monday and the line was not long.

l80kwk1hXmGRegJYnPAc4A.text: Worst buffet I have ever been to for brunch in my life. most of the food  looks nice but tastes like s#it. Don't go.

3VcomLuMTgGr5zKKsd5G0A.text: Ok never been here before and I have watched videos of the buffet on Youtube. l knew it was cheap and a small buffet. I dont mind if the buffet is small as long as theres quality food. I went for the dinner once I arrived in Vegas. There was practically no one at the buffet on a early Sunday evening.   The buffet was quite small but what they had was decent. The Italian section had the usual pizza and pasta. I tried their gnochi and cheese ravoli and surprisingly it was really good. I also tried their Chinese section and everything there was very flavorful. In the meat section they had hand carved turkey which blew me away that it was so juicy and flavorful. They also had top round but wasnt interested. There was also roasted vegis and rope sausage. I didnt eat it but they also had a taco bar with carne asada and taco meat.   The dessert section was decent, pies and cakes plus hand scooped ice cream, few flavors but enough to satisfy.   Its $14.99 for dinner (regular night only, they have specialty night) with a player card and for that price its hard to beat. I was very surprised by how flavorful the food was even tho it was a small buffet. This isnt the Wynn or Caesars palace where the buffet is $50 plus per person. Trust me Ive been to both and sometimes quality over quantity.  Id definitely eat here again, just for the Chinese section, turkey and pasta and some ice cream. Nothing fancy but food done right. Its cheaper than eating a burger and fries and a drink at some places.

v4kJToOchQok0malzy1R5g.text: The lobster feast is a disaster. I have to wait more than 3hrs in line. The lobsters were dry and have no flavor to it. The New York steaks were chewy. The stuff crab had no crab in them. Just the crab shell stuff with bread crumbs. I almost choked on the salmon. They were over bake and taste less.  Oysters and clams were sticking to the shell, smell and taste like rubber. Chinese food and desert were horrible. Disappointed.

I0VaL5c-DiHYab5WKhOdxA.text: This review is limited to the all you can eat lobster buffet on Friday nights.  The lines are long, but they have the best seafood buffet in Vegas!  The lobster tail is super delicious!  Their lobster claws are very good and plenty!  They have great varieties of other seafood including shrimp, mussels, clams, raw oysters, and their New York steak is delicious!  Service was friendly and their desert selection is good.  We really enjoyed this buffet!

DD97sAsbfMaey5f0QpZ_BQ.text: This review is based on their Polynesian Luau Buffet every Saturday evening. My family and I have been homesick and was looking for a place to enjoy a Hawaiian style dinner. We have been reccomended by fellow 9th islanders and my parents stumbled across an Ad inside Las Vegas edition of Kama'aina magazine and with the help of Yelp we decided to give this place a go. We haven't been to Silverton in years so we were bit surprised to see the upgrade throughout the property.  Once we arrived at 5pm, there was a long line with the familar Pidgin accent that was spoken among the many customers in line. The Aloha spirit was present including the many Ohanas(families) that filled up the Buffet. It took approximately 30min. when we finally got seated inside plus it didn't help that they we came across alot of Uncles and Aunties, Lol.   The food items that were present was abundant in selection and typical to what you would find in Hawaii. FYI, Hawaiian food is influence by 5 cultures that includes China, Japan, Philippines, Korea and Portugal. This unique blend of cuisine is known locally among Hawaiians as, "local food."  The items that we had were, -Roasted Pork w/ the head of the pig. -Ahi Poke -Tako Poke -Lomilomi Salmon -Pork Laulau -Teriyaki Beef -Seaweed Salad -Cucumber Salad -Kimchi -Poi  and various items.  Everything was fresh and delicious with a few items that could use a little improvement. The Teriyaki Beef was a bit dry and the Ahi Poke was a bit salty but consistent with flavor. I personally like the Pork Laulau, which is pork meat that is wrapped up in Taro leaves and steamed. The staff was pleasant and the atmosphere felt like we were back home! It would've been nice if they had a Hula, Polynesian and Tahitian Dancers to set the mood, Lol. Even having island style music play in the background would've been nice to have. Then again I could wait for the Pure Aloha Festival for the Entertainment. Overall, I would personally come back and take family and friends to check this Buffet out.  2017 Yelp Review #16

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Polynesian/Hawaiian Luau at Seasons Buffet! ALOHA!

yhOoLC0VhQH0M926qAbPKw.text: Great little mid-tier buffet.  As you know from my other reviews, I am not a big fan of buffets but the honey likes them.  We have visited during Polynesian Night and I have to say the roast pig was damn good eating.   The seats are comfy, the servers are nice and the buffet is clean.    The only drawback to our last visit was an incident with one of the buffet custodians.   The guy behind the buffet grabbed a can of something and sprayed it on a mess at the Chinese food station.  The spray also landed on the white rice and along the rim of the white rice.   It sort of freaked me out because my assumption was that it was a cleaning agent.  After inquiring, they showed me it was a food safe generic non-stick spray coating (Pam) and that it was harmless.   I still stayed away from the white rice because who wants Pam flavored rice?   They need to find a less intrusive way of cleaning.    Maybe I am over reacting to having food safe non-stick spray coating my food but it just turned me off.  Yet another reason I don't like buffets!

trVK5kCjh3blaWz4eTiESA.text: This buffet wouldn't normally be my first choice, but fate insists on bringing me here consistently. The inlaws choose to meet here out of convenience. The buffet has grown on me and there are some good items. I like the prime rib. It's never dry and is consistently good. The highlight is their fish taco station. Tacos made fresh and delicious. Don't forget to tip! The service is great and staff are friendly. The Polynesian buffet is popular and offers tasty fare. I've attended on occasion. The lines never take long to get through. The restroom is very close to the buffet. This buffet is average and will never let you down. If you leave full, thats good enough.

KM52xkO2dCHVrma039RRbg.text: Do not waste your time here. Not worth waiting 4hrs for low quality seafood. Not worth it at all. Will never ever come back here.

UTEhsfKxtqamJS-0TcZRnQ.text: Solid 4 stars!  Although I'm a tad biased because we only visited on Saturday night for their Polynesian Luau dinner.  What can I say?  I'm from Hawaii!  We like a good luau!!  We visited the Seasons Buffet TWICE in a one month period for their Polynesian Luau.  First time was because got a coupon from a Hawaiian magazine that offered a 2 for the price of 1.  Second time was because the brother in-law was in town.  I handily admit...the 1st visit with the one FREE buffet was soooo much sweeter!  Mainly because it was cheaper.  I delve in cheap.  Except with health insurance, you can never be too cheap.  Of course, for a Saturday night the buffet was busy!  Line wasn't too bad though, maybe a 15 minute wait.  And lots of Hawaiians!  Can't be all that bad then, right?!  Go where the locals go!  OK - this being a specialty night with their Polynesian Luau, I stayed away from the other 'American' food for the most part to focus on the island eats!  All Hawaiian food for me, baby!  And I gotta tell you...I enjoyed all of it!  It was really almost like being at home on Maui...except the lack of a proper BEACH!    Food was ONO-licious!!  That means 'yummy' to some of you!  I get it, may not be the top in quality when compared to an actual luau in Hawaii but the effort is totally there!  The local Hawaii food we're used to was all there:  -FULL roasted suckling pig! -Pork Lau Lau! -Ahi poke! -Lomi Lomi Salmon! -Teriyaki beef! -POI! -Even Haupia!  I think I ate like King Kamehameha!  Multiple servings of everything!  I understand some of y'all think this kind of food is well...gross...but for a local boy this is a taste of home!  I definitely stuffed by belly full!  Quality of food was great too even with some minor missteps.  Roasted pig was good but wish the skin was crispier.  Ahi poke was good but should have had less onions.  Same thing for the Lomi Lomi Salmon.  Teriyaki beef was good but sauce shouldn't be runny, beef should be MARINATED in the sauce - not sauce poured on afterwards.  Poi was surprisingly pretty fresh, not sour!  Haupia was made like back home, perfect!  I'm not gonna complain about the price either for Seasons Buffet Polynesian Luau, cheaper than a luau back home!  With the Silverton player's club card, only $19.99 a person!  Totally good value for all you're getting!  And don't forget, you still get access to all the other buffet eats like prime rib!  Pizza!  Sushi!  Absolute food fest.  Had an excellent time at the Polynesian Luau at Seasons Buffet, we'll be back again for sure!  CHEEEEE HOOOOOOOOO!!!!!

rI2WrjdhXQ6A3M-ZB2ljdQ.text: Whenever my family is in town we always have dinner at the Seasons Buffet. Our server Antoinette AKA Toni did an awesome job. The food was delicious as always. This time they had gnocchi in pesto sauce, it was so good. We will definitely be back in March, hope to receive the same great service and delicious food.

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner with the fam bam!!!

pkDDWlunm-JLuzObra4cMw.text: Hands down, this is one of the best buffets in Vegas. Forget those high price buffets with the bland food. The food is seasoned just right the desserts are great and they have a good variety. 10 min. max from the strip and well worth it! Inside the Silverton Hotel.

ECLNHWO_Cbqk3Z5G7cOJ6w.text: The lack of quality at this establishment is inexcusable.  They don't replenish dishes, so when they're out, they're out or it takes them too long to refill/replace. This is one of most frustrating things at any restaurant at the Silverton, one of which I've even tried contacting a food and beverage manager about but was never contacted back. There never seems to be one on hand to speak to during business hours/ hours of operation either or they simply have heard it before and don't care. It seems that it's a combination of their employees being lazy to refill their selection and that they simply purposely don't order enough food to meet the demand that they have for their restaurants, so they try to "ration" it out.  Also, dishes on their line routinely are all over the map temperature-wise and in regards to salt content. One dish might be McDonald's-lawsuit-piping hot, while another will just be just sitting there mired in its own juices at barely room temperature. Multiple dishes were congealed/coagulated and looked gross. Couldn't a chef replace these dishes or at least stir them so they at least looked acceptable?  Flavor is not existent as many items are simply throw away reheat dishes from the freezer (i.e. their mix of carrot and peas, etc.). There really isn't any pride in their work,  both from the chefs on hand and the servers/ waiters/ front staff that seats you. Here it isn't that the customer is right or at least has something valuable that should be listened to, no, at this establishment the client/ customer is wrong from the get go. It's a pattern not only through this restaurant,  but across the board at their other restaurants. On this particular visit,  the most egregious things that I witnessed on top of the lackluster service and food was that there seems to be a bug infestation going on at the Silverton.  I saw multiple dead bugs inside the property at their foyer when you enter from the parking garage.  There were multiple live bugs in the foyer as well, such as a cockroaches (massive ones at that). I wish I had been able to take a photo of these bugs for this Yelp review, but they were/ are there and it's exceptionally gross. I cannot believe the health department hasn't denied their grade or suspended/ shut them down. I witnessed these and flies at their buffet as well. Simply gross.  You should really,  really think twice before coming to the Silverton because other than it being an ok/so so deal at some of their restaurants, the price you pay for health isn't worth with the bug infestation they have going on and the lackluster food/service.  It is really beyond me to give this place even 1 star. If I could,  I'd give them negative stars. It is also incredible that they have the general (stars) / average that they do.

Duwk_yFc-6I05UECRMvVrw.text: Taco  Friday! Tacos were soggy.  Chimichanga was cold.Won Ton soup and Mac and cheese good as usual.  Bun was stale on sausage.  Sausage / sauerkraut/ onions had great beer flavor. -- eating lunch at Seasons Buffet at Silverton Casino.

TKGHm13ZjRfQoV7Tcn8kwg.text: This buffet is located at the Silverton Casino. I have stumbled away food drunk from this Fine Epicurious Gastronomique establishment many a time. If I time it right I hit it on a Saturday which is Polynesian night where I spend a few hours devouring Fred. (Fred is the name I gave to the roasted suckling pig) Although, Old Fred is long gone his name still lives on in memory through is brothers and sisters who graciously offered up themselves (as Fred) every Saturday night for the firm price of $23.80 gratuity not included.  Besides Old Tasty Fred. This buffet offers up a lot of tasty Polynesian fare that one might miss unless of course you go to Polynesia. Or come here and stand in line for almost 2 hours with mostly Polynesian folks some the size and strength of tanks that could easily kill you with one punch. That being said,  you know the place is worth it. Some of my personal favorites are the Ahi Poke, Lomi Lomi, Tako Poke, Sushi, Kalbi Beef Ribs, Suckling Pig with Crispy Skin, Kalua Pork Loin, Pork Lau Lau. They also offer up a really nice New York strip steak as well as all the standard buffet stuff you normally find.
