gbgdS1A_-7Pf40ivmQ1bbQ.text: For the price which I usually go for lunch $11.99 with players card is amazing usually a lot of buffets have bland food but you can taste the flavor. They also have a taco station which is really good. Amazing fish tacos! Great location as well.  If you don't want something crowded plus the casino doesn't smell to much like smoke.

-kFMFkbsrv92cPkJTBuYoQ.text: So we went to the buffet at the Orleans last night... the girls waited in the very long line while my husband & I went & got our players card to get the discount... the line was really long for both btw...anyway...we got in line with the girls & had to wait another 10ish minutes...then were seated rather quickly... they all started with a salad...I made a beeline to the meat!! I'm not filling up on salad at an ayce...so the "prime rib" was just ok & the au jus tasted horrible...but the ribs, both (smoked) pork & beef were really good...the Mexican street corn was probably the best thing I ate...I ate 3 of them...lol... the girls ate normal stuff but split a bao...they said they were just ok...not as good as what you get in Chinatown...they added salt... Donna's sirloin was over cooked...she said the shrimp scampi was her favorite...& I will have to say that it was perfectly cooked despite sitting there on a heat tray for god knows how long... the potato salad had too much pickle juice....the mac n'cheese was just ok as was the scalloped potatoes... I tried the Hot n' Sour soup...too spicy...just ok... My husband said the buffet was "nothing special"....he said the turkey sucked... but there were lots of things to choose from...salad bar...Asian stuff...Italian...Mexican... mudbugs...I tried one...over cooked... The dessert bar was nothing special...I tried the pecan pie...ehh...I tried the sugar free key lime pie...ehh...I tried the strawberry cheesecake pudding...that was good...except too much strawberry goo on the top... I tried the lemon gelato...ehh...tasted like they used fake lemon juice...Katie like the coffee gelato...

RIBxa3gxAuBJDUbfgqooQQ.text: Not horrible. Also not coming here again.  It's got Polynesian/Hawaiian flavor and feel to everything. I actually love Polynesian food however this buffet just wasn't impressive. I'd rather save some money and go somewhere smaller, more to their roots of Hawaii.

Ya0Jk4VT0dZjbQTj-cyglA.text: Seasons Buffet is exactly the kind of hidden joint I'd expect to find when exploring eateries outside of the Strip.  And although, it's not really all that totally off Strip, it's far enough away that your efforts to visit them will be rewarded with extra attentive service and better eats.  Best of all, Seasons easily outshines other similarly priced buffets with the sheer quality and variety of their offerings.  So, first of all, the place looks great: modern space with plenty of legroom so not to impend on the comfort zone of fellow diners, a back wall filled with enough tvs to watch the game and the Food Network at the same time, and best of all, each and every serving station is pristine.  I liked finding two buffet items normally not served during lunch: grilled veggies and brisket.  The brisket was tender and juicy.  It was a little under seasoned but if you dab a little BBQ sauce, it's bound to impress.  The grilled veggies were crisp, slightly caramelized, and probably one of the healthiest things I may have ever had at a buffet (is that sad?).  The showcase item was their fish tacos.  And I'll be the first to admit, they are exceptionally done.  The outer taco shell is crisp-ily grilled while the inner shell stays bendy enough to help house, not only the moist and tender fish, but all the fixings that make it so yummy.  My only gripe is that you're limited to only 2 tacos per order . . . which, I guess, in retrospect is pretty smart considering I'd probably go overboard and OD on them.  The desserts were a little disappointing . . . but to be expected for a buffet.  They were mostly bad but not completely terrible.  I was able to finish half a scoop of cappuccino ice cream and a sliver of cake; although, the fact that I don't remember what cake should say something.  Fortunately, instead of ending my outing with dessert I had one last order of fish tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YFYhYJ1ZF3BYePjHDXJLRA.text: Ate here for dinner the Saturday, Polynesian buffet. It was ok, but nothing mind blowing. Luckily I had a 2 for 1 coupon, so it was worth it for that price. Was looking forward to the suckling pig, but it was just ok. The poke was fresh, but needed more flavor. The Lomi Salmon was very bland! The rest of the food was alright, but nothing you couldn't find somewhere else. I did like the Haupia for desert, though! The service was good and the employees were friendly. My plates were quickly cleared and my drink was always refilled. If you're at the Silverton Casino already, go for it, but I wouldn't drive across town for it.

TW1meU9u21St4OQSbYIfyw.text: Note: This review is for the Polynesian buffet that the Silverton has on Thursdays, though I'm not sure much changes from the regular buffet.   I usually wouldn't go the Silverton buffet since we have so many other good places I'd like to eat but someone wanted to go so I decided sure why not? Have to try somethings at least once.  The decor: Not bad, it was actually pretty good, not completely amazing but not so cheesy and tacky that you're reminded that you're at a buffet and feel like a tourist. But pretty much what you'r expect from a buffet, one thing I didn't like is that the bathrooms are outside and in the casino, not that big of a deal for some but kind of bothers me.  The service: Excellent. Very attentive. Everyone was nice, conversational, relaxed and everyone just seemed real kick back.  The food: The primary purpose of going to a buffet. Can't say I was impressed by anything they had to offer. It wasn't the worst buffet I have ever had but all the food just seemed to be real basic. There was your Italian section - eh, you're Asian section - yawn, salad bar, small dessert area and a couple more areas that weren't very memorable. If you were hungry, it would've done the trick but my biggest problem was where was the Polynesian food? It seemed like their regular buffet with maybe 4 or 5 Polynesian dishes. They had some pig, mahi mahi, and pig/pork in banana leaves and that's about it, not a lot of variety and if I'm craving some Poly food again I can't say I'd rush back here.

Id0Ot0pz95tM9d2a-4rryw.text: Only here because of free voucher comps. Note my first choice in Vegas!  Went back 2 weeks later and really had a nice meal.

a7bQfBA5YYXVXMIiZCN8tg.text: The food was very mediocre. Most of the food was very greasy and bland. Many of the Asian dishes such as the lemon chicken were undercooked. The only decent part of the buffet was the desserts. I don't think the food here is worth it for the price. I suggest another buffet instead of this one when going to Vegas.

dwnlrpdZotYoqPjR_BGw0Q.text: It depends on what you want in a buffet. If you just want eat a meal and everyone can choose what they want, then it's a good choice especially for seniors on a Monday.  If you want a wide variety then this may not be the right buffet. Also remember the selection really don't change much.   I had a piece beef with a salad and it was good. Dessert selection looks decent, looks like all store bought.  The service was friendly and prompt. We didn't have to ask for refills.

kj8W8_AE0YIm4RpUN36t-w.text: The food was not only tasty and fresh but the service was absolutely  delightful. I have been to a few buffets here in Vegas and this one's value and quality  rivals none...

p6RF3LMquuo_HxocbctnRg.text: There's a variety of dishes to choose from but it's not as large as many of the high end places on the strip.  However, the quality of food is pretty good and the prices are really reasonable. Off the top of my head I recall, there were Asian, American, Italian, and Seafood sections, a small variety of salads and soups, a carving station with Turkey & Prime Rib, an area with some grilled veggies and large kielbasas, many different kinds of pizza to choose from and a good assortment of desserts. They also have a pasta station where they help create a fresh batch to your liking. I've gone here about 3 times now for lunch and it's roughly the same.  It's a great last stop before you drive out of town (lunch M-F is only $9 with Silverton casino card!).  Good buffet food at a very affordable price.  Tip: Get a Silverton Lodge Casino Discovery Club card.  It's free and helps you accumulate points for comps while you gamble. You'll also get a large coupon book which has a couple 2-for-1 's for the Seasons Buffet.  Also, if you are eating by yourself, you can also use the 2-for-1 coupon to just get 50% off instead! However, if you don't have a coupon you'll still get a discounted price for the buffet if you have the card.  It's worth getting!

_7rsQJ7tUEUOOELLMv-sJg.text: HATE Nothing.  DISLIKE The rubbery quiche. Eggs benedict was hard-boiled not poached. Very limited options within each "international" station.  LIKE Choices of protein entrees (turkey, prime rib, lamb, salmon). Dessert. Steamed crabs. Friendly station attendants/cooks. Classier buffet atmosphere.  LOVE Unlimited champagne/bellinis/wine.

NsmCr8VOMuDkWNMPaMOXMA.text: I went to this buffet on a Sunday.  The price was too high for what it was.  Crab legs was the main attraction.  They are so small, its not worth working for your food.   HOWEVER, I must say I thought I was in heaven when i tried the bread pudding that was in a throw away foil cup that sat on a hot table.  I can't describe how delicious this was!  wow!!!!

ahzN5LD6TqfL8t1Dxuz2QA.text: What can I say $5.00 to eat lunch.  Service was very slow to get in and to get the soft drinks.  They looked very understaffed to me. This is a very local place not for the Las Vegas vacation type.  It serves the locals well and does let kids eat here.  So there is a great bargin if you have children. I don't think this Buffet is close enough to the strip or downtown to make a special run here.  They are as my rating states A-OK

TX0CBQys8qNSlCR9BKg0ZA.text: We eat at Seasons buffet once or twice a week, because we get comps.  I find the quality of the food to be mediocre at best, The majority of their vegetables are canned; corn, candied sweet potatoes, Sauerkraut, peas and carrots, etc.  However, the mashed potatoes and broccoli are fresh.  I am a vegan, so that limits me and what I can eat.  I do like their pasta bar and their salad bar.  My weakness was the dessert bar.  The dessert bar used to be great, but they seemed to have changed bakeries.  Now the cakes are too sweet and very dry.   Our friends are not vegan, and they said the quality of the carving station was poor.  However, the turkey was pretty good, with a nice gravy. The price for the regular dinner buffet is $13.99, which is $1.00 less than the, Feast buffet at Green Valley Ranch or Red Rock Hotel.  The quality difference is like night and day, hands down, the "Station's Feast Buffets"  are far superior to Silverton's Seasons Buffet.

5Mvd8rzLIzO0Lzud9dHrpg.text: Who woulda guessed??? Not me. This place is a gem hidden behind the draw of the Bass Pro Shop at the Silverton Hotel and Casino.  Never in a million years would I have ventured to try the Seasons Buffet, if not for the suggestion of my brother-in-law. The place is neat, contemporary, and, bottom-line, the food is terrific, and the price ain't to shabby (two-for-one with players card).   Went there for breakfast and lunch only, so only reviewing for it. Good selection of normal breakfast/lunch fare. Can't recall all the items, but fried chicken is good (so I heard), as was the prime rib, and snow crab. Desserts were also good. From scratch, according to the hotels' website.  Overall good deal for good eats.

QN-aLYAOuXsKKbF6kakqZQ.text: Had lunch at season's buffet in silverton casin salad bar was good. Did care for marinara sauce that I had with spaghetti. NONE of the desserts were any good. Had good iced tea & good service. My husband liked the beef & green beans, mashed potatoes, so don't get Italian food. Ham was good but barb b que sauce no good he said..

Aqk9tfN5nBCIR8YCNWH_AA.text: Room is nice....food....not much of a variety for a buffet.  The shrimp cocktail and cappuccino ice cream were the highlights.  Had trouble getting a server to bring us drinks....

hywiXvOU3VFdAppjJfSmxQ.text: Tip: Join their player's club and you'll get the buffet for $13.99. I'm weird and one of my favorite meals is steak with salsa and tortillas. Some nice lady carved me big chunks of a roast and I got a handful of flour tortillas, a soup bowl of salsa and went to town. Not the highest quality food, but it was good, and for $13.99 it makes you consider gastric bypass surgery. If I lived in Vegas I think I'd be a much larger person.

p2cEUtBiPpKGo3f4q9DT2A.text: My family has been eating at this buffet for years and they have, like the other local buffets have their ups and downs over the years.  I remember when only a few months ago one would be waiting an hour or more in line on a Friday or Saturday night before reaching the cashier, then an additional 20-30 wait to get seated.  Last night (Friday) my wife and I thought we hit our own mega lottery when we saw no line to wait in.  We soon found out why. For the admission cost, using our gaming card, of 2 adults @ $13.99, a minor @ $13.99 and a child @ $6.99 we paid about $49 + added tip.  Unfortunately pre-tipping is a double edged sword.  Sometimes your server is more motivated to proved better service because they see you gave them great tip or they figure, mehhh, they got your $ so I don't care at this point.  Well, ours was in the second category..what a slug.  We had to ask for our frigging silverware.  Asked for extra napkins, and no, that does not mean just 1  each for the kids.  Drink refills, empty plate takeaways, don't get me started.   The food selection was abysmal!  The crab legs were removed from the buffet and replaced with a made to order bananas foster/cherries jubilee section.  (This is not mentioned on their website incidentally).  The self peel shrimp that shared the crab leg section has moved over to where the sushi was offered near the salad bar.  Yup, you guessed it...no more sushi offerings.  Let's see what else did they cheapen out on which is selected in their lower buffet price?  Oh yeah, they offer meatballs in their Italian section, but no pasta for them, yup, there's no pasta offerings at all.  C'mon folks, pasta is a cheap, buffet fill the masses up cheap category.  I fact, the only noodle type offering they had was chow mein.    My kids were disappointed as one of their all time faces at this buffet was the coconut shrimp, which was no longer offered.  The guy at the carving station was obviously in a pissed off mood the night we were there: he was literally dropping/throwing the meat on the plates anywhere.    The positives?  Hmmm????  The cabbage rolls were good, the carved beef, (when you recovered from your plate almost tipping over from the asshole chef flopping the meat onto it), the yams, the shrimp, the lemon chicken.  You get the point.  So I guess, we won't be returning to this buffet anytime soon.  For the same price, one is better off going to GVR;'s buffet that has a much wider election that is a whole lot tastier and better wait staff too.

9lk3GD9LT4fc76BqTkHt7w.text: 3 stars because 1 star would not be fair since I didn't actually eat the food there. My family went to Bass Pro and then to the buffet on a Sunday around lunchtime. The cashier told me that it would be ADULT price for a 7-year-old. Excuse me? Since when is a 7-year-old the same price as a full-grown man? Do 7-year-olds eat the same amount of food as an adult?! At most places ages 12+ is the adult price. No thanks, I'm not paying $20 for my child to eat a dinner roll, fruit, and a dessert since I'm sure that is all he would eat there anyway. You obviously do not want families to eat there if you charge that much for a small child. Our large party took our business elsewhere. We went to the Mexican restaurant in the casino and they were very friendly and had lunch specials. Half the price and lots of food.

BHbgH22r-FXRpc3pPbWCEA.text: Yuck....would have been really upset had I paid for this. It's like cafeteria food. I love the resort and casino, but this buffet is not good.

EpPmfRB6Fo3C93gYqvuIlg.text: some of the worst service ever, half an hour almost to finally get my drink order so needless to say, ruined the meal.would not recommend because of that

UDYGY3Rd-zbCGo2esOrHYw.text: One of the better, mid-priced buffets in town. Nice ambiance. Its a smaller buffet but the food is very tasty, well seasoned.

18ILa1Dh-H-N91n5cmyWcw.text: Everytime we visit my mom in vegas we eat here. Its pretty decent.   This past trip we went on Sunday, which was an all you can eat Bar B Que Buffet. It was $20 per person, but they sent my parents coupons so we ate for free and boy it was yummy.   They usually have a lot of variety, salad bar, asian cuisine (fried rice, veggies, sweet and sour chicken etc.) american cuisine (fried chicken, mashed potatoes all the fixens), Turkey, ribs...all those types of meats. They have crab legs and shrimp...there is so much more i am leaving out. Its a great buffet.   THe service is great...all the ladies are so nice!

Toxl6Fk3tJUAUDxccdSZyA.text: I wanted to try this buffet since it is very close to where I live and I have to say that it's a pretty good buffet.  First, it is easy to access (right by Highway 15) and it is easy to park there. The line at the cashier can unfortunately get very long though. I was there on a Sunday and since they had a BOGO deal the line was very long and it took us over almost an hour to actually pay and then get a table, when there were a lot of free tables available...   Once in there, service was good and the food decently good as well. This buffet is reasonably priced and you get food that really isn't that bad for a buffet. There is also a rather large selection of food options.  The main problem with this buffet is that they will kick you out after 90 minutes there! So be ready to eat and drink as fast as you can, which can be a problem since the lines at the bar are sometimes pretty long and it can easily take 10 minutes to get one drink. At some point, the bar ran out of clean glasses and I didn't get any drink for over 20 minutes...  To conclude, this is a pretty good buffet option, but be aware that logistical issues due to the way this buffet is managed might ruin your experience...

-284VI7DyX4O1hYoOj-Ahw.text: Been to Vegas twice been here three times. We win we eat at a reasonably priced buffet with pretty good food. Our waitress Maria was awesome very professional and attentive. Highly recommend.

MMDogKsEqXIJSG_odfJiAw.text: They have sushi, Asian food, tofu, steamed bok choi, Singapore noodles,just ono!  This buffet is clean,orderly, and has several live stations. Love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seasons Buffet decor.
Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wHiROMUCjatuQ2qBEOPv3Q.text: Both times that I have been here was not by choice. I forgot why I never came here but now I remembered why. This place sucks! A lot of their entrees had too much salt or lacked flavored. Beyond disappointed that nothing hit the spot besides the lau lau which was decent enough. To top it off I didn't even enjoy their desserts. Glad both times I came I did not have to pay as I was treated but even then I did not enjoy the food. Never coming back and our server sucked as well.

9LqPC9gmiGU1Zf3H7Epydw.text: Not good at all or how I remember it from last year. We got to Bellini Brunch with a little less than 2 hours before it ended. There was a long line to pay as well as to get seated. There was a sign that said all guests were limited to 90 minutes because they were so busy. Thankfully it didn't take too long to get seated. As for the food, it was mostly yuck. The bad- The top round wasn't tender. All of us who had it could not cut through it or chew it. The clams weren't fresh and smelled like dirty ocean water. Mussels smelled as well. Carved turkey was dry. Fried shrimp tasted stale. The desserts were horrendous. The cupcakes were dry and crumbly. While the lemon curd cake was moist, it barely had any flavor. The coconut cake didn't taste like coconut but instead the frosting and filling tasted like vegetable shortening or margarine. I hate wasting food, but I spit out a lot of it!!!! The good- their pizza actually tastes delicious. The mashed potatoes were great. I love how they offer a ton of grilled veggies by the meat carving station. To make it worse we were there when they started changing out the Brunch items for dinner that started at 4pm. The people working were so aggressive in cleaning the place up. There were several times I'd be waiting patiently while they swept crumbs away and wiped down the counters in between serving trays. I got side eyed like I was intruding in their space. Or they would just jump in front of me like we were hassling them. I get it, Vegas is damn hot and can make both servers and customers miserable, but still! Made me want to leave, what horrible service! I wasn't trying to jack from the dinner menu, I was just trying to enjoy the 90 minutes at the buffet that I paid for. While this place is relatively cheap, $19.99 regular price, $17.99 with Silverton Rewards card, it has not lived up to what we experienced last time.

yi26XYs7GpYpE0JSU3OE9Q.text: I eat mostly green foods and very little meat.  I.love buffets because I can get more variety of greens. This place has a good variety. Plant based eaters can do well here.

w7BHuXtyjPjyUZKmFf6C1g.text: My wife, son and I went to Seasons Buffet on the first day we arrived in Las Vegas.  The restaurant itself is beautiful.  It is spacious and looks amazing.  The food was also very good.  We received a buy one get one half off from another person in line which decreased our bill significantly.  I enjoyed the Italian and Chinese food the best.  My six year old son enjoyed the ice cream.

NUzjBAQJEn4zfPIaIqXl0g.text: Oct Thurs BOGO review. Thru the month of Oct, sign up for a players card and get a coupon from one of the kiosks to print out a BOGO coupon for the same day. That comes out to about $5pp for a buffet. And you know what? The food wasn't bad! Now this isn't the best buffet ever, but for $5pp it served it's purpose.  The fish tacos are surprisingly good. The fish is grilled, not fried, so you don't have to worry about soggy fish. The fish itself is very moist and smooth. Lots of other standard buffet items, but what sets this place apart is the cooking stations. You can get made to order pasta, meat at the carving station, etc.   Another tip is to play some games the same day you get your players card. With only 50 points you get a coupon for another free buffet! We used it the following Sat for the Bellini Brunch. Surprisingly, the food at the brunch wasn't as good as the Thurs lunch. There were some standouts though. The eggs benedict was one of the best buffet benedicts I've had. The Hollandaise was make correctly. Very rich and buttery, with a nice kick of lemon tartness. There's prime rib at the carving station, and some ho hum sushi. Desserts were better on Sat tho.  The Bellinis available were raspberry, mango, sunset, orange, and another I'm forgetting.  I'd definitely come back again this Thurs to take advantage of the BOGO. Hey that's tomorrow! If you come between 2-3pm there won't be a line. We got in line right before noon and we waited 40 mins to get to the cashier. The dining room isn't that large, so all tables were full.

2DdgLTmBfkL8DwRF1IDbng.text: Everything was excellent.  Every item I tasted was great.  It has all the standard food items and some extras.  Chefs specials.  I always stay on the strip but I would drive to this one again for the food. Inexpensive.  The Mac and cheese was honestly some of the best I've had.

mB2U72ZGtno3mfhSbMrS2w.text: We recently visited this buffet and it was AWESOME. My husband and I started off with Salad. We then went to the foods such as Meatballs, Prime Rib, Chicken etc. We had Mac n Cheese, Potatoes, Summer Vegetables, Rice Pilaf, etc. My husband sampled several Deserts. ALL the food was Fresh and Tasty. Nothing was old or over cooked. We sampled a little bit of many different offerings...............all great. We're going back this weekend (we're locals) to try it again. The bottom line is that the Seasons Buffet was a very different experience for us compared to other buffets in the area.

FqdOkWSZAI9TRe5MKVkkKQ.text: whether it is lunch or dinner, seasons buffet is always a good value.  I love getting fish tacos during lunch.  for the price of a 3 fish taco plate at a place like wahoo's, you can enjoy 3 fish tacos plus the rest of the entire buffet for the same price!!!  salad bar has all your typical fix ins.  there is a pasta bar which you can create your own tasty concoction.  there is Italian with pizza and pasta.  the Chinese section has 2 soups and favorites like orange chicken, pot stickers, and Singapore noodles.  there is a carving station that had beef brisket and corned beef.  my mouth is water just thinking about the food.  and this is just lunch!!!  Polynesian buffet is another story.  you've got lau lau, tako poke, ahi poke, chicken long rice, roast pig, haupia, lomi lomi salmon, poi, the list goes on and on.  and for $20 you can't beat the price.  if i am having a craving for Hawaiian, you will find me here on Saturday night!!!

XvZDctBrqMVXyhpiqIJoWg.text: Still one of the best casinos buffets I've tried. Prices are also very cheap compared to the casinos at the strip. I recommend coming here right when they open for obvious reasons - food are freshly cooked. Line also tends to get backed up later on in the afternoon. Their beef brisket is pretty good and I love their liver with onions. They basically have flavors of the world. Fish tacos are also made to order. They also have a really good dessert selection. Try the fruit tart - you will not be disappointed. The manager who helped us was very accommodating to our large party. The employees behind the counters are the unfriendly ones. I still have yet to try this buffet for dinner but I'm sure it'll even be much better than lunch. Can't wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing! Including the flower.

oJEqFtQCIuK-cKEhIqffDA.text: Lots of good choices here at a reasonable (compared to other Vegas venues) price. I was in a party of 5 and all enjoyed the food very much. No complaints. Our server was very attentive and helpful. Hope to go back here before we leave.

B_qYQ5eCvfeS-SSs7e7_dg.text: So let me start off with a basic fact about me...I am NOT a buffet person!  I will NEVER, EVER  suggest we go to a buffet.  I only go when I am outnumbered or when family is visiting. So take this review as you may.    I went here for the first time this week since I had family staying at the Silverton.  I have eaten at many of the restaurants there and have always been happy, so I was aware of the food quality level and just went with it.    It started off with us in a short line to pay and be seated.  Even though it was a really short line, it took over 25 minutes to get a table.  I'm not sure why, because there were a lot of open tables that I could see and they seemed to be adequately staffed, so I am not sure where the disconnect was.  So that just put me in a bad mood because I was pretty hungry.  Just a warning for y'all, when I get hungry, throw a cracker or something at me because I turn into that girl from the Exorcist when I am starving.  YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED.  Next up, the food.  I was actually surprised how many sections they had available.  There was a soup and salad bar, pasta bar, pizza, American comfort food, Chinese, Mexican, roasted/grilled meats, and a dessert bar that included freshly made ice cream.  It wasn't a huge buffet, but i found plenty of items that looked and tasted pretty good.  No, it wasn't as big as the World Buffet at the Rio or fancy like the Wynn, but it was ok for what it was.  So yay for that surprise!  The service across the board was hit or miss.  Our table server was very nice and on her game.  She did great.  The hostesses were all a bit grumpy.  Some of the chefs behind the food counters were not happy to be there, but the chef at the meat craving station was just adorable.  The chef in the dessert section was happy.  So it was a little all over the place.  So Seasons is an average buffet for Vegas quality.  If you are a buffet person and in the area, it is an ok place.

gsnYOl7ncSn0cCYD1iut7w.text: I've probably been to this buffet more than any other buffet in Vegas because I live next to this casino. I have to give it five stars because I've eaten some incredible meals here.  If I've ever had a problem it is been with the staff that you pay at the front of the line.  Not any of the other staff that works in the restaurant. When issue we had was our two for one coupon was given away to a random person because they didn't check his ID.  Then when we got to the front they check their IDs and they still couldn't honor the coupon. The coupon would've saved us about $15-$20. So it was very annoying and we actually got an argument with the staff and that shouldn't of happened. Proving who we were with her IDs should have given us our hard earned coupon because we gamble there quite often.  We heard a lot of crap about "policy" blah blah blah but they didn't have "policy" for the other man they gave our coupon away to. But for the most part I'm vegetarian and there's a lot for me to eat here including Thai food or sushi on certain days.  My fiance is a meat eater and there is tons of meat on the menu. We both always love to eat here so we just try to ignore the cashiers who are kinda snooty and have a hard time with customer service.

Xob4AwEdqNJKQc7M8tCrSw.text: This restaurant has a large variety of food, which is fresh and very good. Non of the food was greasy compared to other buffets I have had in the past with other restaurants. The interior decorations were very nice, with a brown / dimmed lighted ambiance. The restaurant was not loud which was unexpected. The restaurant had several televisions inside which displayed ESPN which was also a shock. The price per person was not that expensive either. I do have to say, that I was shocked all the way around and enjoyed the experience of this restaurant. I must if you are visiting the Silverado hotel.

dRpIX5vxfSEV6tXgd-E4ZQ.text: The normal, inexpensive, weeknight buffet looked sloppy so we almost decided to eat elsewhere, but ended up trying it anyway.  Much to our surprise, the food was seasoned well and tasted wonderful!  When we mentioned this to the manager, she said she would "tell the chef".  If you can get past its appearance to try the food, we recommend this buffet. You can always arrange the food on your plate so it looks good!

VZm6BmRb_dS9gEYk077v3Q.text: The food was good, not a huge selection but for $10 it was not bad at all. Wish they would have had more fruit to choose from. Service was good, food was good. I would recommend it if you are in the area. If you are. It, then I don't think it's worth the drive.

2F4raZPUt7aRko5UWTA83A.text: I do not agree with these reviews. I went on a thurs eve and most items were not too good. Selection slim. Go to the Sundance cafe instead or if you want a buffet go to the M Resort buffet. I guess if you were starving a few items would be ok. Not impressed.

E5-94c3eTXwfwbwOD4jbnA.text: Just sent one coupon for two people. Corporate getting cheap. Specially nights are expensive.

zyc4EMOiv_MSJ-BbIMlFZA.text: arrived at 730pm and could not get in. they close the buffet line exactly at 730 . the manager susan who was unapologetic said "next time get here sooner" 1st time at this hotel and will never come back . do not come here! bad management and poor customer service!

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All the angry people who drove here and could not eat! And the manager brushing everyone off without a care in the world.

GteC5yMCu1jRwqjk5LL49A.text: This is my favorite buffet to eat at now. I think my family and I have been here 50+ times and every time we are extremely happy. The food is amazing the service is amazing. Staff are all really friendly. It's so good! Definitely should try it out if you're skeptical it's definitely worth it. Also if you've had a bad experience here maybe try on a normal dinner night instead of their specialty nights!

OjUC4QVW0MX7XfnmabDFcw.text: Great as always. Fresh, lots of choices. Very good for a Monday lunch and price was good!

-RVjA3d9iDVHDr1bRy0g5Q.text: The Friday night Lobster Feast Buffet is no feast... After waiting a half hour in line (yes, we were there at 4:05), we were eager to enjoy LOBSTER?!? Yes, there were lobsters, but the "crab stuffed lobster tail" was more breading than one can imagine. The "broiled lobster tail", on the first round delicious, the second ewwwwe...no quality control. As for the "stuffed crab" that too was a wreck of breadcrumbs. Never mind about the clam bakes or crawfish bakes, I was hard pressed to find any meat. The "shrimp and crab salad" was a True gem if you're into bell peppers. Oh, and if you love spice and sesame oil, the ahi poke has plenty to offer, as an added bonus onions are heavily sprinkled throughout. And while the "lobster tacos" were made fresh to order, best to get those on your way to your table...cold tacos are not the business and the salsa seemed to get even spicier.  But! The big finale is their dessert offerings: pies with no flakey crust, the curious wondering of what is what and hand scooped ice cream that's more ice than cream. No, thank you!!!

PtEPVvRk3lW3sBwInVmwzw.text: Tried the buffet on a Saturday evening. Very minimal salad bar, the only fruit I found was pineapple, and it had chili on it. Most everything had meat in it and there were a lot of pork dishes. Many of the dishes were empty and needed to be re-filled by the staff. The service was good but I was disappointed in the overall food selection and that I paid $90 for 3 adults and 1 kid. I now know that Polynesian food is not for me. If you are vegetarian or vegan, seek a buffet elsewhere in town. If you like pork, meat and carbs then you will probably enjoy this buffet.

90M6cpU6pdDvNW7QTVz6yQ.text: The suckling pig was excellent! They have a huge selection of foods to enjoy also the resort is across the street we own a condo in the Berkley resort and if you don't want to eat fast food this buffet is a excellent choice

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ pork,suckling pig mac&amp;cheese,pork skin sirloin steak and corn on the cob hit the spot!

27i1ZvYXKJA6gyT_aj8RhA.text: I eat at MANY buffets around the country and I see many things, that many people would find repulsive if they paid attention. They do not pay attention! The fact is that MOST buffets are well put together and very safe to eat at. The food is nearly always very fresh.  The problem I see happens nearly always, as it did today right here at the Seasons Buffet. It is the frequently nasty habits of many of the patrons that will definitely spread germs. Next time you are standing in line waiting for the buffet, look closely at the people in line with you. Are they picking at their nose, putting their fingers in their mouth or just playing with their greasy hair? Did they even bother to wash their germ covered hands when they used the restroom just before coming to the buffet?   Some of the slimiest people you may ever see anywhere are standing right in the same line with you and some with their grubby little children, AND they will ALL in fact be handling the exact same serving utensils as you. BET ON IT!  Whenever possible I always like to be the first in line to avoid many of the disreputables, that put their hands on the serving utensils. Do this and you will avoid much.  It says that Seasons Buffet is the Best in Vegas. Who knows? It is not as good as the Sierra Buffet in Mesquite, but I have eaten here MANY times over MANY years and I have nearly always enjoyed it.   Sometimes the service gets pretty lame and especially if they are busy. I do not like to be eating for 15 minutes before the server even bothers to ask what I would like to drink. Other times it is very good.  Overall, most of the food here is really tasty and I like it. The salad bar is lacking. I compare this to the Sierra's Buffet in Mesquite (90 miles northeast on I-15), where the fruit and salad bar is far above reproach. I've never seen anything like it anywhere.  My favorite thing here after eating is to always check out the marvelous aquarium at the front of the Silverton and the other freshwater aquariums in the attached Bass Pro Shops. The BPS here in Las Vegas is the most impressive I've seen anywhere around the entire country. The visuals are amazing especially if you are an outdoors person. The whole place is highly recommended. A genuine Vegas experience!

qKvS3gscAiQwcT16qlsHGA.text: Needed to hold up 40 minutes to be situated. The nourishment was repulsive. The smorgasbord has a little choice and they all pose a flavor like solidified nourishment. The most frustrating was the orange chicken had an aftertaste like cardboard and was super hard.   Try not to squander your time here, there are numerous different smorgasbords that taste much better in Las Vegas.

EqxeYYtAUMcKg7bBCybCjA.text: This should get negative stars. My husband and I ate the buffet yesterday for lunch.  My husband ate some hot food and finished with a salad. He has been vomiting ever since. This has ruined our Thanksgiving

KlY3PmCcjUzWH-DFFaOSnQ.text: I am always a firm believer that you pay for what you get. This buffet has a pretty good variety compared to the bigger name casino buffets where you will pay for double or sometimes nearly triple the price that you would here. They have a Hawaiian night on Saturdays where they have everything from authentic Hawaiian dishes such as Kalua pork. It is nice to be able to go here when you want a little of everything. There is something for everyone to eat. I would like them to give a little more time to guests to get more food when they are about to close. 30 minutes would be better than the 15 minutes they give guests for last call.

x_et4CC2JvxUYk965bOsrg.text: This is such an amazing buffet, we came for the seafood buffet on Friday night. It is amazing! We come for the regular all the time and love it.

87V46nSX24VqLhZ7zZB5Zw.text: This casino has the best seafood buffet deal in Las Vegas and the most comfortable country setting that makes a person so relaxed, and I have lived in Vegas for 20 years and this is my favorite restaurants, casino, and bringing family to and they DONT charge for parking like many other casinos do. And I am always greeted by all the employees!         Steven  C.

3ibm_5aUbcXBvLtPajqdaw.text: Probably one of the best values for buffets. It is a smaller buffet without anything too fancy, but what they have is very good. Even knowing the buffet would close in less than 30 minutes, the workers were still replenishing the food for those of us that showed up for a late meal.   Food was just really good and was probably as close to having that home-cooked taste that a buffet could ever hope to have. Probably also one of the few buffets I've been to where the sugar free desserts actually tasted good. Our server was super nice too and actually stopped to have a conversation.  We actually voted to eat here again on the same trip, but unfortunately arrived as they were closed for the switch from lunch to dinner so we ate elsewhere (and regretted it).

MDSffQJx1Jx8ew64Olga7g.text: Running to grab a bite to eat before our early check-in at the airport and this buffet was the perfect location. Second to location is finding a place that could accommodate me having Celiac. I figured being a buffet it could accommodate us both and it did not disappoint. I asked one of the black coat wearing chefs to show me the unobvious items that had gluten. He came out from behind the buffet with the head chef and between the two of them I got all of my questions answered. The selection of non-gluten items was not vast, but what I ate was very good. They found out though that the sausages contain gluten and are cooked right next to the beef hot dogs which do not. I explained to the chef about cross-contamination. The beef brisket and turkey could be cut with a fork. The sweet potatoes were really tasty. The vegetables were not overcooked. Compared to the insanity of price at other Las Vegas buffets and all things considered this was a perfect selection.

Ev4EhGgxMMay_qDrea0dyw.text: The service was wonderful and the food was delicious, and it was a very pleasing atmosphere. We came on Polynesian night, the roasted pig was amazing, we had bok choy, lots of spicy chicken and pork, poke, sushi, veggies, and cheese cake with  strawberry topping. Highly recommend!

d01bXK5-cJNsEiFpC9tsjA.text: There are restaurants worth waiting 2 or even 3 hours for. This is not one of them. Lobster tail was dry. Service was slow. They make most people wait in line with no seats but still many empty tables inside. Miss Rio Seafood Buffet. It was $20 more but the wait was not long and the food selection was superior.

dwr20ai627pbByDc502UTA.text: This buffet has Hawaiian food on Saturdays. We enjoy eating here for the Hawaiian buffet because the food is mostly pretty good.   The have fresh poi, poke, lomi salmon, lau lau, sweet & sour spare ribs, kimchi tako poke, Teri Beef, Mac salad and kalua pig. They also have haupia for desserts.   They also have other good food here. The service is quick if you have a small crowd. If you go with a big crowd be expected to wait 30 - 45 to be seated sometimes. Of course if you go early you get seated a little quicker, but once there's a line for the buffet it will take some time.

lD6G3B1MbHs5G5yvZVcCFg.text: It was a last minute decision to go to this buffet. My best friend and I were looking for a place to stuff our faces and I saw that the price for lunch was super cheap.  Selection was great, they definitely had a lot of variety. Some of the dishes were great and we really enjoyed the seasoned tilapia and lemon chicken. Our favorite was the Little station that they were serving fish tacos from. I would go to the buffet for the fish tacos alone. Desserts were also amazing, they had cute little dessert shooters. Don't bother with the Rice Krispies. They were very dry and not made with enough marshmallow. The brownie was very good and rice.  Overall, it's a pretty decent buffet if you're on a budget.

VtM7rwXgF33kiPUtS_p63A.text: So, this location is pretty neat. The Buffet is attached to the Bass Pro Shop. The staff was friendly and are great at saving its clients a lot of money. Before purchasing a buffet for two, they advised us to sign up so we could get a but one get one free deal. So for two people we paid about $12 with some change. It's all you can eat and food isn't bad. You're spaced out, so the noise level is pretty low. Our server was extremely attentive.

3UnFopT5Ix3gw45vrysaAg.text: We have gone to the Season's Buffet at the Silverton many times simply because it was closest to where we were staying at the Oasis RV Resort. We get in and have dinner on Friday. Some nights are more than 3 stars but overall it rounds down.   They dinner on Friday is called the Harvest Buffet (?) for  $22.99 regular price and $19.99 with the casino rewards card. It's not a bad deal considering you get all you want to drink (milk, soda, coffee, tea), appetizer, soup or salad, entrees and dessert. The thing I like about a buffet is that I can try many things but the bad thing is the quality isn't high. You might find some things you really like but most is just ok.   Harvest buffet means fresh food from whatever season it is (I'm told) with different stations of Soups and Salads, Seafood Station, Carving Station and American, Italian Stations. It was regular food-nothing I could say was seasonal and the Dessert Station seems the same as always-pies, cakes, etc.   We tried the Polynesian Buffet once but it was right when they first starts it (way back) and I wasn't happy they replaced something we liked. So I don't think I gave it a fair shake-though my husband loved the pork. We will try it again after reading the reviews. I'm not sure why it's more expensive  but it's $23.99 regular price and $21.99 with the rewards card.   Sunday from 10am - 3pm they have a Bellini Brunch which is a nice treat for breakfast out. They have the regular breakfast foods with some that are a bit more special. Just the Bellini cocktails make the meal. It was  $19.99 regular price and $17.99 with the rewards card.  Seafood Night is Thursday (which is odd since I always expect it on a Friday).  It seemed high for what we got at  $32.99 regular price and $30.99 with the rewards card. The seafood was pretty generic and nothing special for a Las Vegas buffet.   We have gone on Mondays for the 50+ Buffet Day since we are over 50 and get 50% off a Buffet all day. The small print is is not just for your age. You must have Gold, Platinum or Diamond Silverton Rewards Club card which means playing a lot. Then you have to get a printed coupon from their machine and show a valid photo ID. I don't play that much. My husband qualified for the Golf so he would get half off and mine would be full price. The meal was good for half off but not so great at full price.   We were a bit disappointed with the buffet. Casinos used to bring you in by offering good buffers at a reasonable or cheap price. Now, the price on some nights is high enough so I expect more.  Considering you get a full meal, it's pretty good.

lRe2KbxhrsZ6ebagsRCr8Q.text: I was very impressed with this gem.  Price was only 9.99 with a players card.  Excellent optios, and everything from the fried chicken, meatloaf, mashed potatoes, etc tasted as good as home made.  Great quality and fresh.  Staff was super friendly and attentive.  Excellent dessert sectio as well.  I cannot say enough about how much I enjoyed this will be back!

7NROFEOMHOIUt3vlXIMBcA.text: The worst buffet in Vegas or anywhere! My wife and I just finished dinner there and were very disappointed. The food was bland and dry as if it had been sitting there for days and the desserts made us sad. Who puts old lemon frosting on dry red velvet cake? They do! Unless you dislike yourself and everyone you are going to eat with do not waist your time and money on this place.

KrKm0g5IpvZhPI7r9aKVBw.text: I paid a lot of money for my whole entire family and the service was horrible. The waitress was rude and had us put on plates on her tray. When she thought that we weren't going to tip her she flipped out was very rude. They tell you to leave shortly after your visit!!!!!!!!!

VevR1L2ndrdpteHYJJKgWw.text: After a whole slew of problems getting a  hold of someone at Silverton who would book my reservation for my rehearsal night dinner for my wedding at the buffet, I finally did actually book the reservation. I even gave my credit card number to hold the reservation as the guest list for my party was 25 people.  We arrive at Seasons on the night of my rehearsal dinner and the incompetent girls at the register know nothing of my reservation. In fact, they point out to me, "We don't take reservations". As I slid into a monumental ball of anger and lost it, yes I really did, lose it on this girl, she finally got the idea I was not joking and got her "manager". Ah yes, to no surprise, and to my chagrin - who was the manager? The woman I booked the reservation through! Since I was about to start peppering this woman with the worst curse words I could think of, my mother and father stepped in and spoke with her. Oh, well our reservation had gotten "lost in the scuffle" of Silverton changing over management styles and who takes reservations for what. WELL THEN - where is my credit card information!? I'd like to know that.  Then the lady says, don't worry we are setting up the table now. Okay. What if there had not been enough room in the buffet to seat our 25 person table, what then? As the lady keep apologizing and we march into the buffet with little servers still scurrying around trying to set up our non-existent reservation I am still hopping mad.  The food is mediocre. There's a pasta bar - woo hoo. There's hardly any selection of varying ethnic cuisines. The only decent section is the dessert bar. On our night there they were making excellent bananas foster.   They didn't comp us. They only apologized after my father insisted they apologize to us for losing our reservation. They still charged us for drinks even though they ROYALLY FUCKED UP.  Never again. And I suggest no one ever eat here and definitely don't even attempt to make a reservation ANYWHERE at Silverton - they'll lose it - and your CREDIT CARD NUMBER TOO!

JfzgwVERssuXE0sytt8tFw.text: Great deserts Shockingly slow cashiers.  Food overall was OK.  People told us it was fantastic. it is not. BEST I've had (see ALL my buffet reviews) is the Planet Hollywood Spice Market.  Sit near the back wall where you can see all the flat screen TVs mounted. They show fantastic photograph!  The food staff are great, and they even had cappuccino ice cream!  GREAT!

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mdyTwgb8lShr5Pd4VzDhyg.text: Saturday brunch was great.  The salmon was perfectly cooked, the pad Thai was great, and the prime rib was good too.  The best part was our server, Louise.  She's definitely an asset.  Oh, and the free Champagne was good too.

Ah77TjDgWIdnM9UIc6nyMQ.text: Located in the Silverton Lodge Casino, this is one of the best buffets in town. I recommend the specialty nights Cowboy BBQ, and Polynesian Night, neither are particularly authentic, but hey this is a buffet, leave your food snobbery at the door. The food here is always fresh and the prices reasonable. The great thing about buffets is that if you are traveling with a bunch of people there is something at a buffet to please everyone. If you find yourself at the Silverton give the buffet a try. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

Ypoi7_07mDrjMVLbUTEKTQ.text: Decent Buffett. Nothing spectacular. Very clean and well stocked fresh food. Reasonable for the price.

0UGFvYQQD1viG5mWH0bESg.text: Sure the whole neo lodge casino thing is cool but this was a poor experience in buffet dining.  From the attitude throwing cashier to the frowny faced cooks behind the line, no one and I mean no one seemed happy to be there.  That coupled with the second rate truck stop chow being served made for a bunch of laughs as the group laughed our way through  about just how ridiculious an experience it was.

wB9UEVWmrcgeogyJPHKxgw.text: Been here several times, never too impress of the selection of food... First time at sunday brunch,, real disappointment, nothing to write home about, lucky for me I did not pay full price, as i held a $11 food credit, next time I will just use it at cafe (it is also pricey there too to eat).. I must say the server was very prompt on drinks and checking to see of we were ok... Spend a few $$ extra and venture down the road to the M Casino (studio B buffet)

1t7FA01C1Ajj3TqrT-obow.text: I really enjoyed this buffet. I think the price is worth the food. My husband and I have been to dinner and brunch here and enjoyed every time we went. It has a good selection of Italian food, seafood, Asian food, BBQ section as well as salad bar and desserts. On sunday morning they have a brunch with a champagne mimosa bar, which is awesome. It not just job and champagne but they have a mango mimosa as well as pomegranate ones as well. Some of the highlights there would be the grilled vegetables. Really delicious and  their creamy polenta. I also liked their mussels and clams as well,really delicious.

VxLWtPbGzVH5LW6Qu2vlAg.text: Worst buffet ever. And I waited in line for it...   The veggie pizza wasn't cooked all the way so was doughy and disgusting.  The clams had a disgusting stringy thing in it so I didn't eat any more (looked like hair).  The only edible items were the mashed potatoes (can't mess those up) and salad bar.   How do you have bad service at a buffet? Seasons manages it! The person who led us to our dirty table was a fat balding woman who didn't greet us, instead jutted her fat arm into the air half way across the restaurant for us to follow.   One of the waitresses spilled water all over a customer.   I only paid $10 for 2 buffets and it still gets 1 star.

MRGWcGuBDAqLGIj1BoKd6A.text: We came here for lunch since we received free lunch with our membership.  Unexpectedly good and a very good price ($10 for lunch but we didn't pay).  Don't expect spectacular and you'll be alright.  The clam chowder was delicious as was the brisket.  Same with the mac n' cheese and mashed potatoes.  I wish their Asian selection was a little better but that's about my only complaint.  They have a good variety of desserts too and I had several that were very good.  I definitely will come back here again.

7IXEGDjyO1N4hoRM4m7JYw.text: I just adore this buffet. They aren't that expensive and their food is very good. Plus, they occasionally have specials and send coupons via snail mail.  I went on Polynesian night (on Thursdays) and I was so impressed. They had authentic Hawaiian food, like kalua pig, and even a whole, roasted pig! I was in a tropical food heaven y'all!   I also went for lunch on a Monday. The line can get long, so wear comfortable shoes and be prepared to wait it out. They have fruits, salads, a carving stations, and delicious desserts! Go here!

Pqln5b_Ga9WTyhXBM7IxJA.text: Came here on polynisian night cause we all got the free buffet via Reward card (otherwise it would have been $21.99). Spacious and not overly crowded.  Excellent - Kalula pig and kalbi Beef (so tender, juicy and delish!), Cheese Ravoli  Good - Chicken Noodle Soup,  Ok - Poki, Tomato Bisque, Japanese Salad, Mint Chicken wings  Meh - Dumpling soup - the dumplings were too doughy and not much filling.  Icky -Flower Egg Drop Soup, Luau pig was too dry and the skin was NOT edible.

DglWpP5hdTdnNzNQWc1VMA.text: July Tue/Wed BOGO...that's a good deal that's close to home.  Kids r satisfied and the rest of us had cocktails.  If you are an adult, do not go sober...the ratings will decline as the sobriety increases.  If you pay full price-2 Stars, but for $8 its okay.

GbfHt9hqB_NYowcRyR6Ccg.text: 3.5/5 Of course this isn't the fanciest restaurant but the atmosphere was overall really nice. The ambience was quiet and quite intimate almost. Went here with my husband, it was $19/person with a members card. Service was good and attentive. The asian guy as our bus person and the ladies at the cashiers were friendly. No line on a Friday night around 7! We had a good experience but disappointed in the limited amount of food. They had a German section, seafood, salad, Italian, asian, and dessert. They all contained about 6 dishes. We didn't even try the salad because it looked..well plain. The watermelon was sweet though! The Italian section was probably the richest flavored. Had pasta, pizza, other stuff I don't recall.  The asian was nothing extraordinary. Singapore noodles were probably the best in my opinion. Egg drop soup was good.  I didn't try much of the German food, but my husband did. He is German himself and he didn't want me to try some of the things because he said it'll give me a bad rep of the food lol.  They had good sir loin however. Went back for seconds.  Seafood was mostly fried stuff (cod, oyster, clam, shrimp). 3/5 for those. They also had cocktail shrimp (nothing special, was low the whole night) and cedar plank salmon(not too big of a fan).  The dessert had the biggest variety but nothing that appealing. Chocolate strawberries were good. Only three ice cream flavors (Neapolitan).

uLxIpwLTSgfxpHVkRcN1Ag.text: Jan. 4, 2015 just have a brunch at season buffet cost $20/each. First the cashier name Jocelyn helped us I can tell right away she's not willing to help us. She didn't even smile and hesitant to answer questions.  So we end up going  in anyway.  Her customer service is really poor. The food is not even worth of what we pay. There's not much selection and it looks old. So it's a waste of time and money. Last time we were here was good that's why we came back but not anymore.

aG8Y3pw0_pm89L3wFUOKjQ.text: OK..while the atmosphere is pretty cool and eating to classic rock music is awesome...the dinner here is NOT all that.  4 stars?  5 stars?  Are you kidding?  What's the Wynn or Bellagio buffet then?  So many multiple orgasms in your mouth that you'll die right on the spot??  While there are some good things like the pasta station and the carved roast beef...some of the other stuff was under par like the egg drop soup (enough sugar in it?), sweet and sour chicken should've just been called "sweet chicken", pad thai and lemon meringue pie.  And even though the price certainly padded the cons of the place, I don't plan on eating here ever again.  The diner would be a better call unless you're ravenously starving.

1mpMWGO-iREk00cdgOP1Ow.text: Very nice Bellini brunch. This is truly a hidden local secret. Took my in laws and great Grammy there on a Saturday around 11am. There wasn't a whole lot people no line at all. The whole staff from the cashier girls to the servers and the manager were so so nice. Please bring some tip money to tip your bar Bellini tender especially Anne she was the nicest person ever and she makes the best drinks. If you have a rewards card up to four people gets to eat for $17.99 unlimited Bellini or soft drinks included. Of not it only $19.99 and for that price food was not bad at all. Not gourmet food but good food for a buffet. Also the atmosphere was really nice and the Resturant was clean. Beautiful decor and comfortable seating in a large space. It was totally worth it and on Saturday nights they have the same deal for a Polynesian dinner. That I will come back to try. For a local spot it is a good deal!

Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast
Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left regular mimosa right Sun Rise both were so good but my favorite was the peach Bellini was awesome.

bMVbVAEZFEmYca0t2jYAOw.text: It's a OK buffet compared to others in Las Vegas. Good value is spaghetti cooked to order. During the visit, no clamps were available, so had shrimps. Fresh fruits are a disappointment.

Al91Rn8utJoQnNy9e6zdlA.text: Went to the Polynesian night for dinner! Best decision made for dinner. The selection was really good, food was very delicious. Everything was clean & well kept full & plentiful. Price was great for the selection of food that was available! Ahi poke was the best I have had in along time. Definitely will be back for this one & well be sharing with friends!!!

ndTC-BtXRDLDvUL7m4AZ1g.text: Always make it a point to hit this buffet up when we are in town. The service is excellent and the atmosphere is good. While it isn't a "mega" buffet, the selection is the right amount and prepared wonderfully. Usually can get a good deal if you have gambled a little in the casino first.

hWZFSurjlaK8s0KVoGsZug.text: The service was fine and the food was ok. But in a city known for food and service, ok doesn't cut it.   We had to run an errand in the area and decided to grab dinner while we were there. I think we would have been better off saving the money and going back home.   There was nothing remarkable about the food. I ate some mediocre dishes that seemed to largely come from frozen. Nothing was horrible, but we will not be going back.  On a friday night, there was no prime rib, no seafood, nothing at all special.  And at $17 per person, I really wish I would have taken a few moments to read reviews before we'd gone in.  I could have had a much better dinner for the same dollar hundreds of other places in the city, literally.  And in the future, I will be doing so.

0XpPOk8YCL_u9XRPs-dD_w.text: Awesome food short lines great service I will be back great ambiance you later bye bye hi Haley recommended

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jNIfpbnhQ1zeeXsvgko28g.text: Nope. Not even worth the time or money. Overpriced brunch. Poor choices. Dry food. Had a hard time deciding what I was willing to eat. Had crunchy French toast which was heavy on the grease, so they must have been deep fried. Bacon was wilty and greasy. Salad lettuce was dry--how is that even possible? Mac n cheese was tasty. Waitress was a sweety. We definitely won't be back

GNS9AHV4Xic-VDZnU-DApA.text: Guess I forgot that I already thought this place sucked 2yrs ago. My friend had a $25 dining credit, so it ended up costing about $5 for 2ppl. With that in mind, yes it was totally worth it. Actually even for the $14 full price it was an ok deal since it includes soft drinks, dinner and dessert.   I cant think of even one thing that stood out as good - everything we tried was pretty mediocre, bordering on bad. Even the ice cream doesn't look like real ice cream anymore - they seem to have switched to dairy dessert stuff. For people that work in casinos - it's about the same quality level as employee dining (that isn't a good thing)  You're better off paying twice the amount for a better quality buffet on the strip. For reference, the Main Street buffet is much better than this.

eumUr6R31PN43l46ioUOKw.text: I come here when I get a buy one get one free in the email, comes to around $8 a person...good value for dinner.  Very good: Fish tacos made to order, egg drop soup  Stay away from: The carving station; My table knife would not cut that piece of meat.  The desserts are 2-star.  The line can be long on those buy one get one free days...be prepared to wait at least 45 minutes...

UaWfWTLD6PopivSJy-WuKw.text: Decent value and selection  Had a "free" pass on a players club promotion so used for a lunch upon my departure. Wow what a surprise. There was a variety to choose from and no one station appeared to be overextended (offering something at poor quality just to check off another item on offer.) Salad bar items were fresh and my cooked items were all of temperature. I did arrive shortly after opening so there wasn't time for anything to lay about.  Will visit again, and pay out of pocket, on my next LV visit. For the money I enjoy the variety compared to a sit down restaurant especially when with others.

kPwBwsoRTBrqxnKdYF8a3A.text: We haven't been disappointed yet. Varied menu. Desserts are better than most Casino Buffets. I was satisfied for low carb items. The grilled veggies are alright. The oil that is used to grill them, always has a rancied taste for some reason. The cashiers, hosts, and dining room staff are almost always courteous, friendly, and attentive.  Out of ten visits, we had one server give us an attitude when we asked if we could order beverages while half way done with our plate. We will go back. The prices are a good deal.

tiDCG469i4HzmDj8sIfBlw.text: I've dined at this buffet a few times, most recently this past Sunday, Easter. I can tell you, there are far better buffets in Las Vegas, but there are also far worse. Seasons is most average. Not a whole lot stands out. Service is good, atmosphere and decor are nice. The food is mostly good - the prime rib at the carving station is better than average. I enjoy the freshly scooped ice cream, but the rest of the desserts are mostly meh - the cakes, especially, taste as if they were made in an assembly line bakery off premises. Still, the buffet is a decent bargain, as long as you don't set your expectations too high.

qlZ5kzuMJ-nKboEAB1Ks3w.text: This buffet isn't really "bad" but I don't think I'd come here without a promo or comp.  A lot of the food is very greasy and while the serving stations look like there should be a huge variety, a close look shows just a few small pans.  I've been here 3 times and the selection doesn't really change, the dessert station is solid with an assortment of simple items like pie, cookies and ice cream with a few "fancier" cake like items.  I normally ask for 2 glasses of whatever drink I order because I've gotten burned here before with waiting a long time for refills.  That being said, I've had worst, but I doubt I'll come back unless it's a free or reduced price.

QuSUXCL-HnbPjKcSMa5SsQ.text: Like it. The Silverton has a really good buffet. It's not "fabulous you must try this dish" kind of good but it's Las Vegas buffet good. As far as local casinos go, I'd say it's above average. Definitely better than the coast and most station buffets.   Last time I went was on Friday for their seafood buffet. I ate crab legs, peel and eat shrimp, oysters rockefeller and a decent paella. The crab legs were a little overcooked and hard to crack. They are precut which is supposed to make them easier to crack but the shell was a bit rubbery so they were kind of pain to deal with. When I did get to the meat it was not overly salty which I really like. Lots of buffet crab legs (and buffet food in general) is too salty for my taste.  This Silverton runs some good promotions periodically and Friday night we bought 2 buffets for the price of 1. It was $25 before tip. We arrived around 6:30ish and there was no waiting but there was a decent line when we were leaving. The service was pretty standard. Our waiter brought us drinks, extra napkins and cleared our plates. Which is important to me. When I am finished eating I want my plate out of my face, now. (Always in a nice way though ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood
Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs

OWuHDFLxIOE-dVgeD-vj1g.text: Omg this buffet is as good as it gets. Went on Thursday for a uye lechon buffet. I never comment on seating or tables but you actually wanted to sit and take your time eating. They don't have chairs that make you feel rushed. Now on to the food. Where to start. Hmm with the salads it's a nice spread. Even tuna poke salad. And the fruits like watermelon were juicy and sweet. From the lau lau to the roasted pig delicious. They never let the side dishes empty out. It would be nice if they had a ice cream machine so I could make my own sundaes. And the ice cream Batista didn't have any bowls either. Guess ill grab a soup bowl next time and bring it over. All in all a pleasant delicious experience. And after 4pm its 5 dollars all you cab drink beer in the buffet.  The server never let my drinks go unattended which is a huge plus for me

UbQuVPir7iA-UNaFjUUazg.text: The BF and I had new players cards and got free buffet coupons with it a long while back we never used. We decided to do the Bellini Brunch which happens Sat/Sun.  The line wasn't terribly long, but it was rather slow. Just doesn't seem too efficient so I am sure $5 days must be ridiculous.   Bellinis come in 5 flavors and I tried the raspberry and the passionfruit (they also had a pomegranate, orange, and pineapple I believe) which was decent, but I just didn't feel like having a drunk morning and getting all of the flavors.   They have a basic salad station, breakfast food station (with a omelette station), chinese food area, American (with lamb and steamship beef roast carving), Italian station , seafood area (with steamed crab) and dessert (with ice cream station).   I didn't try the steamed crab because it was a long line and I wasn't in the mood but the lamb and beef was okay. The surprising standout was salmon that was slightly smoked and served with a creamy dill sauce which was juicy and flavorful.   Desserts were pretty meh. I took bites of cakes that werent very good and finally satisfied my sweet tooth more with the cheese blintz from the breakfast area which was good and a scoop of ice cream.  Service was pretty decent. The plates were cleared pretty fast and drinks refilled.   Overall, it was a OK buffet. Nothing too terrible, but nothing standout. If you aren't here to get drunk or eat so much crab legs you give yourself a allergy then it might not be worth it, but I guess for some $20 isn't bad either. I think I rather spend a little bit more to get a higher quality/ taste ratio to the price.

OXchn7d7NFC1U5Lbi35y_A.text: Went with a friend and the line was almost non existent - prices were fair - food was what you would expect mid day at a buffet.  Overall was satisfied. Check this place out!

61F0kUUVE-qFAkkIj6dwbw.text: The buffet is still a great value for the price. Unfortunately, it was very packed this time around. There were several dozen people there who were a part of a timeshare type of gathering.   It was annoying to have to listen to sales pitch after sales pitch when I was trying to enjoy my meal. Maybe they could have had this group segregated in a certain section of the restaurant to avoid disturbing the rest of the restaurant.

mjyEztV16VOr7TG5SayE8A.text: Well I've been here several times now for the Polynesian night  and I have to say that the food is good for the price. That being said, I only go when I have the two free buffets  promotion (with the Silverton Rewards Club  Card) and with only two people... so yeah, it's really worth it. A lot of items are hit or miss but overall I can't complain and it has actually gotten better each time I go. There usually  isn't much of a wait and the food is always hot and generally fresh.  If you haven't tried it in a while, wait for the promotion and try it again after all free food is better than.. well okay.. it's free food, deal with it.  For the rest of the review, keep in mind that we brought two teens with us that took our price from free to just over $40 before tip. Also, this review is ONLY for the Polynesian night.  Now, for what's good. Their tuna poke seems to occupy a considerable portion of my plate each time. The giant roasted pig freaked the kids out but whatever, they think McDonalds rules the world so they don't count. The roasted pig is very good every time I have it. There was also some salt and pepper pork that seriously made an impression on everyone at the table including the grumpy, texting teens. There were a couple of soups that were really good especially the one over by the sushi that had the clear noodles. I don't remember the name but it looked so nasty that I just had to try it and to my surprise it was actually very good. The Wonton soup was very good as well. The mashed potatoes and bowtie pasta were great. I even had a couple pieces of a spicy tuna roll that didn't offend me as sushi on a buffet can often do.  Also, the peel  and eat shrimp was good but naturally should have been fail proof one would think.  The oysters are usually decent enough except for the fact that they ran out of them by 4:45pm. We arrived at 4:30pm and they open at 4pm and I didn't even get one. Not cool. I stood there and watched as the guy in front of me filled up two plates until there were none left. I was impressed with his lack of consideration for the line of  people behind him and yet jealous at the same time.  The empty space was replaced with clams that had something on them that I wasn't all that impressed with.  The clams were fresh but the topping just ruined it for me, not my thing I guess.   Some misses were believe it or not the macaroni and cheese. Bad enough to spit out. Same  goes for the macaroni  salad and popcorn shrimp. Just bad. Like take it off the buffet entirely kinda bad. No really. Now for the prime rib. Usually it is pretty good. This last time was different. It was cooked entirely rare and if anyone wanted it cooked differently it was sliced and put on a grill to be cooked to their liking. As I watched cooked slices being handed off to other customers it looked like nothing more than a bad steak. I opted for mine rare as I generally like it. Unfortunately I couldn't even eat that. I felt really bad having to leave an excellent  cut of meat on my plate. It just felt wrong.  Overall, the food (on Polynesian night)was good enough to go back, when it's free (or BOGO), if you don't bring teens, just happen to be in the area and are in general just really hungry enough to not care. You just need to find what you like and stick with that. Unfortunately this isn't the type of buffet where you walk in and love every single item that they have. I give it three stars only because I know that what is good is really good and that comprises more than half of the buffet. As for the rest of the buffet,  it may be a bit blah but a person can only eat so much anyway. I just go back to the good stuff and that works for me. If I had to pay the regular price of $21.99 I probably wouldn't go. That being said, I have no doubt that I will be returning when my next promotion comes in the mail.

k3FQzhXnNMst2bqN1RbxhA.text: **Summary** - Bellini Brunch - This review will be just on the bellini brunch. I've tried their lunch and dinner, but I much prefer the brunch. - Crab Legs - They steam up hot crab legs and give them out by the plateful. This makes the Brunch worth it already. There are a couple different dipping sauces (I like Cajun Spices) to choose from (yelp.com/biz_photos/h_g5...). - Champagne - There's a champagne station to grab your mimosas and other brunch drinks. - Brunch - They have all the regular brunch things like an omelette station, bacon, sausage, country friend ham, eggs benny, waffles, etc. - Clams - They have steamed clams that are pretty good. - Cutting Station - They used to have prime rib which was really good, but now they only have roast beef, ham, and lamb. - Dessert - They have the normal desserts you'd see at a buffet (pies, ice cream, pastries). The two things that they have that others don't are donuts and a chocolate fountain. - Overall - I come back for the crab legs, clams, and generic brunch items. If you don't like crab legs or clams, there's probably no point in coming here. There are a lot of other brunch buffets with better items. **Price** - $17.99 with Rewards card - Bellini Brunch - Sundays 9am - 3pm. **Recommendations** - I'd recommend the Sunday brunch if you like hot crab legs.

DcwGgQdVgxtWBAFVYIW55g.text: Not an awesome buffet but pretty good value.  Spent $12 each for lunch.   Solid lunch.  Food: 7/10 Ambiance: 7/10 Service: 7/10 Cleanliness: 7/10

ax6jpbnoafs-hD-RKeY5Wg.text: Coming to try their Sushi/lobster buffet that is only available on Fridays.  It is 5 pm, the Friday after Labor Day where the crowds are usually gone.  It is still a 3 hour wait.  After waiting 2 hours, I went to check to see how much longer, they said another 90 mins to 2 hours.  What???!!! Then I ask them, how people does the restaurant seat?  The restaurant holds 200 people at a time and VIP Plantinum members only need to wait 30 minutes to be seated.  So if you are not a high roller or you're not there at 3:30 Pm forget eating there.  I left there after being on the airing list for 2 hours.

poUzEIWPdbKoqhy_LSOYIw.text: This buffet is really good! I've been here a few times. I would suggest going to the Polynesian buffet on the weekends. They have a waaayyy better selection for you to choose from. And this casino is away from the strip, if that's what you're looking for.   Try to get discounts if you can.  They also have other restaurants inside the casino if you're not interested in the buffet. Peel and eat shrimp, $8 "bottomless" liquor (beer or wine) is definitely a must if you have extra cash on you.
