F3miSeEcaPQ335f6FlZaSQ.text: This buffet is for poor people.  Don't eat here.  It's disgusting.  Ate here today (Sunday) for dinner.

1SoPTr2pcM9fF1ZPdZ9Uhw.text: Lobster Feast Fridays 4-9pm $37.99 ($35.99 with rewards card) My boyfriend signed up for the rewards card right before we went to eat and received a 50% off dining coupon. So we paid $38 for both of us before gratuity. It also includes bottomless wine and Miller Lite.  We came around 8pm and there was only a few people in line. The line moved quickly, from the moment we got in line to the moment we were seated was about 15 minutes.   The service was good. Anne was great. Our plates were cleared quickly, we never had more than 2 plates stacked at any time. She also made sure our drinks were filled.  The selection isn't the greatest so I would only recommend you do it if you like LOBSTER.  They had the typical basic salads, clam chowder, chicken noodle soup, charbroiled oysters, lobster claws, chilled shrimp, chilled raw oysters, pizza, assorted sushi, potstickers, lobster mac and cheese, NY strip, mussels, clams,  grilled lobster tails, crab cake stuffed lobster tail, and a few other dishes.  I tried the lobster claws, raw oysters, charbroiled oysters, potstickers, NY strip, mussels, clams, lobster tails, chocolate cake, and coconut cake. The only thing I would come back for is the lobster tails.  The lobster tails are served by an employee and you are allowed 2 tails per person each time, you can choose whether you would like it dipped in butter or not. Joe, the gentleman serving us was great! He was very nice. Since they serve you the lobster and each person can get 2 at a time, it makes the process quick and there was no more than 5 people in line at one time. We also never had to wait for them to refill it.   All in all, I would come back for the lobster. I had 13 lobsters and my boyfriend had 7 so it was definitely worth it for us.

DIvWxfOB6TvA-Xj_Ui1vcg.text: We tried out Silverton because it was close to our resort and we got a coupon for signing up for Silverton Casino Players Club.  What an AWESOME find! This is definitely going to be a go to for us.   We got the buffet for lunch for 2 adults, 2 teenagers and a 7 year old with bottomless beer for my husband for $38.40. Seriously?! I worried it was too good to be True and the food would be so so. Wow was I wrong!  The food is served in smaller serving dishes on the buffet line but that means they're making more food FRESH more OFTEN! Everything was delicious and between the five of us we literally tried almost everything.   Variety- plenty of options: healthy, American, Asian, BBQ, vegetarian/vegan and PLENTY of desserts and ice cream!   Bathrooms - located super close in casino and very clean.   Staff - PLEASANT, POLITE and happy! So many places the staff seems miserable, but not here. Our server was a wonderful woman and several others came to constantly clear the dishes from the table.   Cleanliness - the food line, dishes, tables and atmosphere was very clean and well kept!   We will, as I already stated, absolutely be back.   You should go, try it at least once. You can gamble or check out the free aquarium, which also features mermaids Thursday's - Sunday's.

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TTnLHwisFnmIxuxrVXYEVQ.text: Hawaiian and lobster nights are the best. Been coming here for 10 years and it's a awesome place to bring family. Restaurant is pretty chill which I like sometimes. You get off work and you don't need to drive all the way on the strip. You won't have to bump into lots of people or wait hours just to eat. Very relaxing with a outdoors theme. Price is decent as well. One thing I do miss is the crab legs. They use to be have them on Hawaiian nights as well.

2Mir1VuTY1sNUFHN9_l1NA.text: For the price we paid, I rate this a 4 star. I happen to eat here on a Saturday, which is when the buffet serves Polynesian food. I haven't seen any other Las Vegas buffet serve that type of food before. Our waiter was very nice, attentive, and accommodating. Kudos to him! The steak was delicious, but the dessert was okay.   Tips: At 9:00 is the restaurant's listed closing time, 9:15 is when they actually take the food away, and until 9:30, they will let you eat. 7 and younger have free admission.

beZCVqKPzKTws36_kapnQg.text: I haven't been to the buffet for a long time.  I remember it as being mediocre, so I wasn't expecting much.  But today, I was surprised.  The food was actually good.  Not dry, not bland or salty. The food actually tasted great.  And if it's the first time you've been here, be sure to get the Silverton player's card to get the BOGO free for the buffet.

vPVL7t7jzQrEghUOLnUdjw.text: We had a party of 15 people. For each person, it cost about $50. There was crab legs, crawfish, clams, oysters, steak, and more. It sounds good but everything tastes odd. The steak and lobster were super dry. The lobster and crab legs were super salty. The crawfish had no seasoning on it. The deserts tasted stale. I would never come here again nor do I recommend this place. I left super hungry because I rather waste the money then eat the food. It's not worth the wait, time, or money.

lbyr7xiR0dn7FwNtR8jDgQ.text: I've had this buffet on my LV to-do list for 2 years. This review is specifically for their Friday Dec 21st 2018 Lunch setting. The phrase you get what you pay for is a harsh reality $11.90 (adult) to avoid a fast food chain is a valid comparison. There is minimal fruit & I mean 1 bowl for an entire restaurant with mixed pineapple, grapes, melons & cantaloupe (I can't eat the last 2), not much of a salad bar either & their popular fish tacos have minimal fish & tons of fried batter & oily toppings. Desserts were hard &/or dry; strawberry ice cream had an awkward taste, like lots of sugar substitutes. The guacamole left such a bad aftertaste I spit out my coffee which was already not good, but forced me to reset my tastebuds with literally sugar power.  Our server gave us attitude with our drink order, 3 waters, 2 coffees & 1 sprite, I have no idea why she would tilt her head back, roll her eyes & say "you're killing me smalls" just bc my brother asked for a type of tea they didn't have. FYI they only have Black tea. I didn't get her name but it was around 1pm. Was there anything I liked? The carving station's brisket, the horseradish, mashed potatoes & miniature eclair. I wholeheartedly wish I could say I'll never return, BUT, I do want to try the Saturday Polynesian buffet which is what put this place on the map for me to begin with. Wish me luck!

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

T-9r4n74Lco1ItWdKci4Ew.text: I have been to the bacchanal, the buffet at bellagio, m resort, and aria. I can say this is the best buffet in las vegas right now, especially the lobster buffet on friday nights. Everything taste good and they actually care about the quality of their foods. Why pay so much for those other buffets when this buffet serves quality food at a great price, especially the lobster buffet! Only $37.99!!! If you're ever in vegas, this buffet is a must try! Plus, you can see the mermaids here voted best free attraction in las vegas!

Kk-3X5VFGNCYcyDYeXvHvw.text: Went for the first time yesterday. We got there around 5.30 and didn't get seated until 8.30pm. So if you do plan on going, be prepare for a wait. The lobsters were mostly overcooked and the rest of the items are just average. Its worth a try especially if you get their player's card, you get 50% off. For this price, its not bad but I definitely wouldn't go back for regular price.

X_lQRVrLTNtf8S3QtHeX_g.text: We came to this buffet because the casino offered us half off if you sign up for the players card...we also got a free deck of cards for signing up. The buffet was $17.99 and we got the senior discount for our entire party of 10 (thanks grandma). We paid about $100 for everyone and the buffet selection was actually very good. We usually go to another buffet but we will def come to this one on the next visit. The prime rib was my favorite but I also tried: mashed potatoes, fried catfish, beef and broccoli, coconut pie and some other side dishes. Also they offer 5 different breakfast mimosas (I did not partake so I cannot comment on the taste) but they were all you can drink.

LD6C4vTDA0vgirPiseqjeQ.text: Located inside of the Silverton Casino. Only reason was we had 50% off voucher for signing up for the players club card. The Buffet was nice good amount of seating and a good amount of food stations. It's your typical buffet with breakfast and some lunch/dinner items. Since it was a Sunday it was their brunch menu. The selection was average some of the seafood items didn't look appetizing enough. The breakfast items were ok but you know when bread stuff is left out for a while it's gets a little hard like the French toast. I was hoping for some pancakes but they didn't have any they had waffles which were ok. The highlight for me was the eggs I was able to get freshly done over easy and the ice cream. Overall for half price it was average I probably wouldn't pay normal price since there are better ones but if you happen. To be stuck here well there are lots of choices. The staff was excellent so that helped as well.

HEdjhq5VCxxDoxf_QGIZGg.text: I don't know what happened to this buffet but it was so bad that I needed to go to Yelp and discourage anyone from even thinking of going there. Slim choices at all stations nothing looked appealing and if I thought there might be something to eat like the turkey it was dry over salted veggies over salted most choices had been sitting looked old even the desert bar wasn't at all appetizing- service was slim. My guests were also disgusted please before you spend $17 dollars or even $10 go somewhere else this place was by far the worst!

rBLbTmp9QFyp0AxJRgg3gQ.text: This a fine example of quantity over quality. Friday night deal for 37.99 lobster buffet sounds like a great deal, which it is however you get what you pay for.  First off, the entire building of Silverton has this weird musty smell / odor which either comes from the AC or the carpets or whatever. either way, it smells pretty bad, nauseating and disgusting which messes with your appetite to eat.  On to the Buffet, Friday night, arrived 3:45pm (they open at 4) and the line was ridiculously long. My party of 2 was not seated till 7pm making this a 3hour wait in this awful smelling casino.  Our server was great, no complaints on service, however the food served there is a big hit or miss. The seafood served there had a unique / different texture. The lobster tails was dry and tough, the lobster claws were also dry and tough. But what disgusted me the most was the oysters. They were absolutely disgusting, nearly vomited. No where tasted fresh or safe to eat. They had this really bad texture and after taste, I immediately spat it right out. This along with the weird after taste and texture of their lobster leaves me wondering the quality of their seafood. Though it was a good price, I would not be returning here for this nor do I recommend any of my friends to try this as well. 3 hours wait, $90 later (2 guest) and I immediate regret eating here, while I was walking out suffocating and trying not to throw up.  Good luck to everyone looking to beat the lobster system.

vTbVdry00Bim4QOMHaq5Ew.text: I was also a victim of waiting almost 4 hrs for the lobster feast. Our party of 3 arrived 4:45pm but did not get seated till 8:30pm. We went straight to the lobster isle to taste their over cooked dried lobsters, they dunk all their lobsters in the butter pot I guess to make it not taste dry. I opted out of that because I did not want any more unnecessary cholesterol. We forced ourself to chug down the lobsters and that was pretty much what we ate. Everything else was not appetizing. It's no way near comparable to San Manuel Casino in California. The quality does suck and they don't got green tea which was another downer.  Been there done that and won't be back.

IkuRvlUw5JrNPhKF-GAgTA.text: Mardi Gras Night out at the Silverton Casino Seasons Buffet! Wonderful and delightful selection and taste! Wow! Silverton did it big on em! 50% for new members! And just one great night! Some pucs for the road for you guys just in case I forget later.....

cLGXbLntKvgHtqDG1xHCOw.text: The hotel was beautiful! I was really disappointed in the buffet! My family and I went there for dinner on Thursday night. It was the worst buffet we have ever went to. I was so suprised especially in Vegas. The food was not fresh, the food area was dirty, and not a lot of options. Honestly we couldn't pick anything we like from there. We had our two teenager kids with us and they thought it was bad. Even the deserts. I thought teenagers eat anything surprisingly no. The only thing that I got them to eat was two bites of the pasta.  It was a waste of money! when we left I had to take them to Steak and Shake. Never again will we ever go there.   Oh what happened to the seafood? crab legs, oysters or even sushi! It did not exist!  Carving Station was horrible the meat look so dry. The Prime ribs seems like its been sitting there for along time. I like my prime ribs medium rare, I honestly don't think they know what that means because their Prime ribs is overcooked.  The employees that work at the buffet section need a class/ training on customer service because they're so rude especially the pasta lady.

T2SEWs12O418eMluUSpS5w.text: First time at the lobster buffet it was.a terrible experience we waited for 3 hours and then left I'm sorry I dont care what you have on your buffet you should tell people that the wait is more than 3 hours ! Will not come back

5essvceGPHCTSLi0AwJEYg.text: That's it. I'm through with giving these guys an annual second chance. Even with a coupon, it's not worth it. I used to be quite fond of Seasons for everything but brunch, which was - at least at the time - a little too-seafoody and not-breakfasty enough for me. (Keeping in mind that I'm a vegetarian.) We all have our preferences. Unfortunately, Seasons can no longer even meet my basic "preferences" for "tasty food," let alone variety or service. Service was pretty awful. We eventually had one plate cleared, but no refills and no eye contact. Hey, kind of like the last few times. (Excepting that one time when we didn't get any drink at all.) The food for me ranged from "inoffensive but I can do better at home" to "Wow. Gross." Here, let me show you a photo of "Wow. Gross.": yelp.com/biz_photos/h_g5... Even before the discovery of hair in my scrambled eggs, they were pretty unimpressive, coming from the culinary tradition of "let's mindlessly let some eggs bake on the skillet, then chop them up with a spatula and call it 'scrambled.'" The waffle was inoffensive. No fruit or cream, though, and you'll have to fight the omelette station patrons to get near the maple syrup. Don't forget to hit the salad bar for butter. It's next to the cream cheese, which would suggest bagels, but instead the only bread you'll find there is dinner rolls Most of the breakfast buffet, other than single tight wedge of eggs, potatoes (bland), and waffle squares, is Asian fare and lunch-suitable items. My one vegetarian choice was some macaroni and cheese of a neon orange hue, right down to the squirts of oil that came out of every bite. Ick. Dessert selection was less remarkable than I remembered. A sort of croquembouche is on display, but nothing that elegant is actually available. Flan, cookies, carrot cake. I remember that on previous trips, those made since Seasons turned on me, usually resulted in a "decent but unremarkable" dessert buffet experience for lack of other options, but this time I just wanted to get out. I did make myself a salad, and that was fine, but couldn't stand on its own as a reason to dip into the dining budget. (Keep in mind that, with 2-for-1 coupon, my meal was only $5.40.) Unless you are a captive tourist with a coupon, you can do better at so many other places. In fact, I'm hard-pressed to tell you where you can do worse.

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scrambledish eggs and... Hair. Ew.

eBBFu0B4gc3_zxCDP-hmtg.text: Clean and nice atmosphere.  The food is good quality.  Much better than the local Station Casino Buffets.  They have pretty decent fried oysters and their seafood is good, which is a big chance at a buffet, but this was good.  Like their dessert options.  Stuff is marked Gluten-Free which is good to know since I don't do gluten.  I would go back.

Pz51KUev1q7HphxUHyzk5w.text: This review is for the wonderful Lunch buffet.  I would rate this buffet as the best in Las Vegas for lunch and I tried many of them.   Unbelievable deal for $9.99 with a players card.  There is so much great stuff to eat at this buffet.  Made to order fish tacos were excellent and a big reason to come here.   The roast beef was the best I have ever had.   The grilled veggies are great!   The Chinese food is even on point and not greasy -  great flavor sand prepared perfectly which is a surprise for a buffet.  The atmosphere is excellent with beautiful high end decor with elements of fire, water, earth, and nature abound.   The booths are super large and comfortable.    You feel good eating here.  The waitstaff is good and attentive, but maybe have too many tables.   They provided the best service possible given the number of tables they served.

wUWpzITuz1mm-ONT-cjMpQ.text: Came for New Year's day brunch. I guess for the holidays they don't have a separate breakfast and lunch schedule, instead they have brunch. Overall, the food was not good. The food selection was limited and tasted bland. For 21.99 per adult, I expected something decent. Sorry to say it but this buffet sucked. However, they did serve unlimited champagne tasting and we were lucky enough to get an attentive  and enthusiatic waitress, making our dining experience a little better.

ZagewrIYMs34AzFev2rDuQ.text: We came here on a Monday evening for the AYCE dinner buffet. Seems like Seniors get 50% on Mondays. We got a BOGO for $15.12 (2 buffets). AYCE comes with soda refills.  - Come around 6-7pm, You'll be in line for a while.  - I've eaten here a few times before, and their players card is pretty lenient with giving half-priced buffets. After a few rounds at the tables, I usually get a free buffet, or sometimes BOGO. They have a BOGO on the Casino Guide too.  - In retrospect, I should have just used the BOGO for their new and improved Polynesian buffet, Saturdays from 4-9pm. The list looked great! All the favorites, including poke. Definitely going to come back for that!  - Anyway, I usually get their chicken noodle soup and the salad. Better than Sweet Tomatoes in terms of soup. Their chicken noodle broth and chicken are great. Noodles are actually macaroni. Haha. Their salads have baby corn. That a premium veggie at ST. haha.  - I don't get the Asian food much, since it takes worse than a cheap Chinese buffet, but I haven't had it in a while, so I decided to delve into it. The Sinapore noodles were like a spicy pancit, which I liked. Get the Wanton soup and Lemon chicken.  - They have a chef making pasta for you, but I passed this time around. Typically, it's a bit too wet for my liking. Drenched with sauce.  - Get the mussels, clams and shrimp. Goes out fast.  - Service was quick.  - Feast buffet has more of a Variety. But for about $8 a person, with a coupon, It's a good deal when you got it!

Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sushi BBQ beef and lechon

lMskMh0R0nmdJ4tp9o8yzA.text: Nice place, no lines(!!!) on Sunday afternoon, I like the food and the deserts, the staff also are very polite. Highly recommended!

AqGGZgGwI4FdxlF-t5Lziw.text: This was our first time at Seasons, a place that is not at all close to home.  We were here for a group dinner, so we couldn't use the free buffet pass that was good on this night only.  Bummer!!  But because the group was already set up in a back area (where, unlike the rest of the restaurant, was WAY too bright), we were able to dodge the line that snaked almost to the door, like Disney World.  That was almost worth paying full price.  The additional down side, though, was that an 18% tip was added on.  Who the hell tips 18% at a buffet????  I was pleasantly surprised to see so much seafood - shrimp in various disguises, king crab legs, baby mussels, oysters Rockefeller, seafood paella, and then it hit me - Duh!  Friday night is Surf & Turf night here.  Mostly everything was well-presented and pretty good.  Nothing was dried out from sitting too long, and one salmon dish - a whole side of salmon over a tomato and onion melange - was particularly delicious.  The steaks were tender and juicy.  Wine was $5 for as much as you wanted.  All in all, I'd go back again, but I'd make sure to go on a night when I can use a coupon!

nh-0sjyoYzJC2wKP26kD5Q.text: I have another buffet to add to the list of "never again." The Seasons Buffet has great curb appeal and decent prices but that's where the good news stops.  I walk up and down the line three times before I found something that looked edible. ALL of the food was drab and unappealing. I tried food ranging from the shoe leather turkey to the eight year old sweet and sour pork and each trip was worse the the other. Even the deserts were tasteless. I tried the pumpkin pie and the carrot cake. It's a sad day when there is no difference between the two.  Our waiter came by three times to check on us, each time asking if I would like a refill on my iced tea. I said yes please three times and yet never had it refilled even once.  This was one of the worst buffets I have ever been to. Don't let this review detour you. Give it a try, but go into it with your level of expectation being pretty low.

vG9MEs9hij_Zdez9I7XpDQ.text: Please DO NOT come here. The food was not taste good, less selections and some of them are spoiled. Very sloppy and dirty on the counter food items. It's not worth it to pay $10- $16 for lunch or dinner. I just wanted to put the words out there. I felt bad if I didn't write this review. I like to share other people don't waste your money eating here. Go to other casinos buffet have better food and more selection items. I would never dine in here again. I am expressing the truth based on my experience.

XeE5rJVB80p-0PsZe4ZX7g.text: This was a decent buffet for dinner. The price for dinner was inexpensive unlike other dinner buffets in the Strip. Their sushi and their aki poke is delicious The food is great although there's not that many selections to choose from. A downside of this buffet is their dessert section. Their dessert section was like an HomeTown  buffet dessert section and I was expecting better. I bet their cakes are Betty Crocker. It was also not neat and it was messy. There should also be more ice cream flavors. Anyway, the servers are very nice. The ambience is also nice as well. This buffet needs to improve their dessert selection.

_DkOHjK2oQdI8KGrN-Nm0Q.text: Gorgeous restaurant, buffet.  The decor and design is breathtaking.  Awesome staff and we had a comped buffet for new player members and achieving 40 points.  Great value.  :)

u8gVkmtSxmpJJr4nNpQGiQ.text: Went to the Polynesian dinner buffet. The food was mediocre. The best food there was the pig. The price is not too bad just expected higher quality food.  The bbq dinner night on Fridays sounds like there is a better selection of food.

12SQgEeKvAoSWGQsoIe3SA.text: The food was actually pretty good, it's worth the money. The dessert area has lots of good choices. My family and I enjoy this buffet.

qn_AbzPPfqBVqu3BB4Wq1g.text: We came for the polynesian night and got the buy 1 get 1 buffet free coupon. $20 for 2 people. The wait was long during 5pm. The staff were not very accommodating to the "regular" folks that already paid while still waiting online for seats, the staff were instead saving a large sections of the tables for VIPs members (who I might add wasn't even there at all)  Got in, started looking around and found that it didn't offer a lot.  Pig was served (always get the skin), poke tasted a bit bland, the chicken wing in sauce was probably the best item there.   Everything else was mainly vegetables and offers very little of other cuisine. The dessert was the worst display ever-- very little offering, disgusting stale looking desserts, and ice cream suck big time.  Not worth my time.

cE0cKTaxKTgIYGzykEtffA.text: 5 stars in April, 5 Stars today. Buffet Food and Dining experience is getting as good as M Resorts in many respects. They are continuously  trying to improve. Sue, one of  the Buffet managers is a great coach with a friendly and customer service team.Important to Note: The Number One reason I visit the Buffet is the incredible nICE Cream Lady, Shawn. She serves a huge dish of delicious new improved Ice Cream. They now serve caramel syrup adding more pluses to the A grade. All the Desert Staff are fantastic but Shawn is my favorite. Ask for her when you partake in their Ice Cream. Management, please acknowledge Shawn for my wife and myself?

ub-WjArVInolhJEllJuavg.text: i recommend dining here during Thursday - Polynesian night!  Try the roasted pig / lechon yum yum!

tLKDn4FHwxHtARh78IJlkA.text: Very disappointed in the turn this buffet has taken.  I've eaten there probably 50+ times (four times in the last two weeks) and in the last few months it has just become OK as opposed to a place I'd want to eat.    My biggest disappointment is that they have removed the beef brisket from the line up.  It was always my favorite and one of the most flavorful tender briskets I've had.  That was the main draw for me, as with many of my friends.    Now I've been told by Silverton that they have brisket every day.  I'm not sure what they think brisket is, but what they are serving is roast beef.  I'm from the South and I know my brisket.  What they are trying to pass off as brisket is actually a cut of meat from hind quarters of the cow as opposed to a flat cut from the breast section.  Brisket can be flaked apart with a fork, as opposed to having to be cut with a knife the way the roast beef they are serving has to be.    Also, it used to be a much wider variety of food on various days, now it is the same thing every day!  The only thing that seems to change up is the Asian section.    I asked to talk to a manager tonight, right after we arrived.  I explained how much I loved their brisket and asked when and if if would ever be back.  She said she would talk to the Chef and let me know what she found out.  She never came back.    I was recently traveling for 10 weeks, so I wasn't in during that time, but if I recall correctly, things started changing before I left.  I was told that they had a new chef, and I'm not sure I'm pleased with some of the changes.  It was perfect before, why change what isn't broken.  I sure hope I don't have to take Seasons Buffet off my recommended list.

Mq79seR9fGttVkiXd1PItQ.text: go if you have a 2-4-1 or 50% off coupon $11.  went on luau day today. and it was just.."meh."    After only 45 mins after opening, they ran out of the good sashimi (eel, tuna, shrimp, salmon) and just had "ok" rolls and a whitefish, not sure what it was.   The pickled ginger was the peak of the sushi menu - chilled, and plenty of it.  (Sarcam if you can't read it..)     So, then I tried the pork.  The crispy skin (best part) was all gone, but the pork was tender.   The poi (gotta ask for it) - and yes I asked for some - was a bit sweet for me.    Lessee...the favorite luau food was the chili-lime chicken, because it was crispy!  The huli-huli chicken was ok, but a bit dry, so make sure you get plenty of sauce on the bottom of the pan.    I passed on the prime rib- was overdone when I saw it two times.  Then the third pass on the way to the dessert bar, I looked good, but I was full.  the chocolate cake with mint ice cream was good -but average.  No gelato.  I looked for some fresh cut fruit, but it was canned, so passed on it.    In conclusion: next time, and only with the $11 price tag, I'll try the beef, lau lau (hidden away), som-moah chili lime chicken wings, and eat the non-sushi items.    Peel and eat shrimp is available, plenty of good choices with dessert and non-sugar added options, but try it once, and try something else.     50+ members have 1/2 off mondays with players club card.

E93_XJRw3BlJ1LqHRyVGOQ.text: I have been to Seasons a lot over the years. It's always pretty solid and they usually have great local deals, which is usually what draws me in.   On this occasion I had friends in from out of town who were in desperate need of AYCE food. I suggested Seasons and off we went. We got in line (which was scarily long) and started to wait. We heard rumblings of a free buffet offer and took turns to go to the Rewards Club  booth to sign up. My fella and I already had cards, but we got free buffets and $5 in slot play for signing up newbies, score!  It took us an hour and a half to get through the line and everyone was getting pretty antsy in line. My friends had a show to get to, so each passing minute was making them nervous about leaving on time. We finally got seated and off they went to scrounge around for a plate of food before they had to run off. The food is always pretty solid for buffet food but I had to deduct a star for slow service and the long line. They did deal with it the best they could as the servers and the rest of the staff were obviously overwhelmed with large amount of people filtering in and out because of the promotion. They definitely need to account for this and staff more people on the weekends.  All in all, a solid buffet that I usually suggest to friends and family when they're looking for good food on the cheap. Bets of all, they have chocolate covered strawberries. I know, the simple pleasures.

Obasb1oO7reZm-aMbohsrQ.text: Saturday night there was 8 of us who came to the Hawaiian Buffet.  4 of them were going to Hawaii and we wanted to let them taste some of the food like the poi, the laulau, the poke and the delicious haupia.  This is to name a few.  They were adventurous and tried the poi and poke.  They have an understanding of what the food is and to know which ones they don't want to eat.  This place is great for us Islanders who miss the good food of home.  Looking forward of coming back soon. Aloha

roZV2TSnut2TaYbxsbdP9g.text: Friday AYCE LOBSTER BUFFET has me begging for more visits! Free beer and wine included!   Lobster Tacos Lobster tails Crabcake stuffed lobster Lobster macaroni and cheese Lobster salad Lobster pasta Plus tons of other buffet must haves!  The AYCE FRIDAY buffet is soooooo good! It is exhausting but worth the effort! You must have a lot of time and be patient because it will take time to get your fill!  They have great service staff as well.   The desserts are delicious and yes they make me chocolate milk at my request.

yfVRdSUkC3CzOwmkYcScKg.text: I've been going to this casino and it's buffet for years. It's always good, not expensive, and great service. In Vegas, that works. This summer, they took a step above the non strip buffets. They added the Friday evening Lobster buffet....this is music to my ears. Grew up loving lobster and was able to eat it often because we grew up on the Northeast coast. If we wanted a few lobsters for dinner, we'd go to the docks and buy them from the fisherman coming in from checking there daily pot. Not by the pound, we always bought it by the lobster. So, it was great. After moving out here, it's still easy to get lobster, just not as cheap, and not as fresh.So, after hearing about this buffet, needless to say I was happy. The price is fair, with casino card, it's $37.99, without the card, $39.99. Still a very solid price. It's $15 cheaper than any other buffet that offers lobster at its buffet, and those are "holiday" prices. So it's nice to have a non strip buffet offering lobster. The buffet menu is very solid. It's a lobster theme, the main lobster offered is as follows, they offer lobster tail, about 4oz each, the first time they seemed bigger, time #2, they were mostly 3-4oz, and at that station, they offer 2 types, steamed tails w/butter, or baked stuffed tails also w/butter. It's controlled by worker and they give you 2 tails at a time. Line sometimes looks long, but it's no longer than 5-6 minutes, at the most!!! At the start of the buffet area, near the salad bar, they offer a raw bar of lobster claws, oysters, shrimp, and cherry stones. All ice cold and full. More "lobster" items are Lobster MAC & Cheese, another lobster and cream sauce dish, they also have a lobster taco station. Honestly, I'm in it for the steamed & stuffed tails. By far the best offer in the city. I've been to the Sterling Brunch for $125 per head, yes, the tails are bigger, and the offering are more expensive, but $125? Never again. The M Resorts offers a "holiday" buffet around Christmas & New Years, it's $55 per, and the buffet is great, the lobster was a burn job, tails cut in half, 1 per plate!!!! That a rip off. You won't need to worry about that here, you can get plenty here. And they all were the same. No difference in taste or cooking with each try coming out from the kitchen. Just a great job with this buffet. They also offer chicken, beef, and the other normal buffet dishes. This is the best lobster offering in the city, by far. Check it out, it's worth it. The only thing that stinks is the wait time. Get ready to wait an hour. So what we did is took turns waiting. We each waited 30 minutes while the others gambled. It's worked out great, just let the people know behind you that you have a couple others with me, there just sitting down. That way you get no dirty looks, or people getting upset because you held the line for others. I always tell people in line behind me that I have others with me just to make things smooth. In today's world I try to always be nice. Anyway, check this out if you love lobster, you won't be disappointed. And I also noticed instead of 4 pm opening, they moved it up to 3pm opening. It works out great for me, I'd much rather eat early. The earlier, the better.

dW18ADL9W9sqaTOFVupa5A.text: = Location: The Season Buffet is located in the Silverton Casino and Hotel. It's on the corner of Blue Diamond Road and the freeway 15 freeway. They promote that they are a Live-Action Buffet: "feature[ing] delicious cuisine prepared right before your eyes, so you can enjoy the freshest flavors possible."   = Setting/Atmosphere: I attended the dinner on Saturday night for their Polynesian Buffet. The inside of the restaurant was beautiful. In comparison to other major casino buffets, they offer limited seating.   = Service: I waited in line for a seat for an excess of 1 hour. During this time the Manager Susan was not coordinating seating appropriately. The bussers walking around excessively not cleaning up tables on a timely matter to address the high volume of guest entering the buffet. There were two people walking around setting up tables, some of them could have been cleaning up tables as well... Personally, the manager besides standing around and bossing people around to do work should have also helped with cleaning up the tables to keep up with the demand.   There was also a side of the buffet that was not being utilized, which could have been extra seating.   = Drink(s)/Food(s): They provided many amazing island food. Featured items like ahi poke, sushi, suckling pig with crispy skin, pork lau lau, lomi lomi, chicken curry and more.  The quality of the food was subpar. Although all of the food was cooked fresh, it was not seasoned appropriately and/or tasting plain.   = WiFi (For Yelpin + Insta): The casino offers free Wifi, however, access is limited in the buffet.   = Overall: I was overall not impressed with the food and the experience was horrible. I do not recommend this buffets to others. I do not plan on returning anytime soon.

o6WXXy0Y2vKqsPK-Gi_UlQ.text: Not good. Most buffets really aren't very good but I just passed through UT and somehow the Chuck a Rama there manages to put out very tasty food for less than most of the low end casino buffets in Las Vegas. Why is this? I think the casinos have the budget to turn out a better product at the prices they charge. The bottom line is that they choose not to. We're back to the lament at the end of the movie Casino about Vegas going down hill. If your casino charges me for parking or feeds me crappy food in the buffet, I probably won't be back much. At least Silverton doesn't charge for parking...

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Lc0n_SL5n9v0zDaCG-fsYA.text: Tips for Friday's Lobster Fest buffet:   1) Dinner starts at 4pm. Arrive at 2pm to be the first or one of the first in line. This should get you seated inside the restaurant before 4pm. Arriving at 3pm or later will have you waiting for 3 hours or more to be sat. The line at 4pm was INSANE.   2) If you don't have a Silverton players card, get one while your companion is waiting in line at the restaurant. They'll give you a 50% off dining coupon that can be used for you and one other person for the buffet. That's $18 per person for all you can eat lobster. Score!   3) They only allow you to get two tails at a time but lines at the actual buffet go fast. Fill up on the tails because the rest of the selection is less than mediocre. The cocktail lobster claws are either waterlogged and/or rubbery. Gross. The lobster in the made-to-order tacos are fried little chunks that are tough and don't taste like lobster. Lobster Mac and cheese was... just not good. Eat a salad and as many tails as you can.   4) Get in and get out. Be considerate to the hundreds of people waiting in line. Don't be that table digesting for 1 hour so you can gorge on one more plate or sit there socializing long after you're done. If you'd be pissed after waiting in line for 3 hours to get to the front of the line and be told "we're just waiting for another table to get up" and seeing a table just sitting there obviously on the verge of a food coma and no longer eating... then don't do it yourself. Golden Rule, people. That goes for regular restaurants, too. Don't sit there socializing for an hour or more after you've paid. You're screwing over the people waiting to have dinner in the lobby and you're screwing over your server who needs to pay their bills.

A2NWWxA3oyra3mIiqBY39w.text: Be warned that Friday night lobster feast is ridiculously popular! Tonight, we waited for over 2 hours! As much as I want to walk away, I promised the husband that we would try it at least once. I honestly don't think I see myself coming back here ever again.   Lobster itself is not bad in fact, it's less than $40 per person so it's really on the cheap side. We went straight to the lobster section, they will give 2 tails at a time. There's 2 options,  the oven roasted lobster tails and crab cake stuffed lobster tails. I like the one first better.   The lobster legs were quite impressive! The biggest and chunkiest I've seen so far lol! It was a little bit overcooked but otherwise it was good.   The buffet spread can be better though especially the dessert section. It's just simply plain and unappetizing! They have a few pies and cakes but who knows how long it's been in the freezer.   Service was great and the staff are attentive. I would recommend coming here at least an hour prior to dinner time. Also, you might want to sign up for the players card for some discount or promotional price.

z0c76nDcYRUPplp7oHJZbg.text: Just letting you know I'm only giving them a 4 because I got a coupon for 50% off the buffet. If it was regular price I'd give it a 3. Yeah they had Lobster crab oysters muscles shrimp clams but some of the lobsters tasted a little mushy and the other ones that didn't were kind of dry. Crab legs are cold. The shrimp were okay and the rest of the seafood I didn't eat. the lines were ridiculous. Just waiting in line you can spend about 10 to 15 minutes to get the lobsters that was limited to two per person of either the regular or the stuffed 1. They also had lobster tacos which weren't that great.

VBkg_9USqeAH_jmXUUS_JA.text: The Seasons Buffet at The Silverton Casino I'm Las Vegas, this small but plentiful buffet is on of my favorite! We revived a BOGO as a gift from our timeshare resort The Grandview at Las Vegas.  It's not as huge as you would expected but it was enough for me. I have seen bigger casino buffets as well as the cruise ships buffets but I was quit pleased with this one.  The food was hot, fresh and tasty to my liking.  I highly recommend this buffet!!  We will return again on the next trip to Vegas.  This trip was " off the strip" trip!! I really enjoyed it

QVdyNKVTroIGzHG0FsErYA.text: I love lobster! or do I just love butter? Well considering the crowd at Season's lobster feast seafood buffet night a lot of people love sea bugs.  I don't love overcooked lobster tails, because of the rapidly forming long customer line the lobster tails are stacked under the heat lamps to get them to the patrons faster-unfortunately drying them out and by the time you get them they're pretty overcooked and stiff. I got the crab cake stuffed lobster figuring that the crab cake would shield the lobster from overcooking, nope - even dryer and stiffer.  The lobster claws weren't the freshest and didn't have the sweet taste of good quality lobster. Many lower and mid priced provide drawn butter for the lobster claws which helps compensate for inconsistent seafood, no drawn butter was provided only sugary cocktail sauce. Another big problem was the shortage of seafood crackers to open the lobster claws resulted in having to wait till they were washed.  The clams in the clam bake were dry, again overcooked. The Grilled Cajun oysters were sometimes great sometimes overcooked. The key seems to get to grilled oysters and clams when they are just brought out before they spend time drying out in the tray but not possible unless you're seated with a direct view of the buffet trays.   Among the positives were the staff who were universally welcoming, efficient, and attentive. The buffet dining room is spacious, well appointed, and spotless. The desserts were excellent with outstanding pies, delicious white chocolate bread pudding and all the freshly made whipped cream a glutton like me can eat in one sitting. The lobster tacos were made to order - fresh, and flavorful. The Savory lobster Mac and cheese was another standout.   When seafood is the featured point of a buffet it should be exceptional or at least good. A steaming table would be better for the lobster tails and drawn butter that patrons could access would make the lobster claws so much better.

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed lobster and lobster claws

HKO-I3DuTCO4C6D74Y-41Q.text: This buffet has special occasion offering at decent prices. The people are friendly and the food is decent.  Our most recent visit was for the lobster buffet on Friday night. It's a True bargain for the price! My favorites were the lobster tails, char su pork and lobster Mac and cheese. The crab cake stuffed lobster had amazing flavor but was sadly over cooked.  I'm a dessert fiend, so I went there too! Their sugar free carrot cake was amazing! Their cookies were chewy (yum). I also need to give a shout out for the mini eclairs and macaroons. Both were fresh and delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is an incredible deal!

hx0pbBQBHPQsEKZqokfQ4g.text: Seasons Buffet was baby's first Vegas buffet! Why the three stars, you ask?   While the food had a decent selection, there was misinformation on the amount of time we had to eat since we came 30 minutes before Sunday champagne brunch ended.... the cashier told us we had 30 minutes TO GET FOOD... our server told us after we were seated/eating that we had 30 minutes TO EAT AND LEAVE so they could setup for dinner... That amount of time is barely enough for adults to eat let alone prepping food for an infant to eat too.   The variety at the buffet is pretty good and reasonably priced (even for a Sunday champagne brunch). The large dessert section is also a plus in my book!   Overall it's a good bang for your buck, but make sure you don't go towards the end of a meal. You will feel rushed like we did.

5vtyvsccUUxkkJcxWEYiNQ.text: I have come to this buffet a couple more times since my last review about two years ago.    This buffet continues to be an excellent value off the strip.  We particularly like the Bellini Brunch on weekend mornings.  It is somewhere around $20 including the alcohol.    With that said, this time we visited on July 4th. They had a  Buy 1, Get 1 Free promotion on that day.  The buffet was reasonably priced and not increased like so many strip properties on the holiday.    With that said, this is the first time I will have to downgrade my star level to a four.  Don't get me wrong, it was still a value and a lot of the food was still really good.  The service was also great.  However, with my buffet rule of 75% of dishes to my liking for a five star review -- a lot of the food was dry and not as tasty as prior occasions to this restaurant.  I still give it an overall four; however, I hope to try it again next time for a return to a five.

iJZIFMzmkVJ1zPXymkWT9Q.text: First time here came to do the all you can eat lobster. I have discovered I like crab legs better. The meat was over cooked and chewy. The line to get in was crazy on the count they had free buffet vouchers if you signed up with a rewards card. Plus side they had all you can drink  wine and beer

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fRIUjlhXGmHcL_RmcWPFVg.text: It can be challenging being a restaurant explorer on weekdays in a city filled with resorts offering fabulous weekday lunch buffets. The Silverton Lodge Season's Buffet is the quintessence of the high quality weekday lunch buffet bargain. From 11 AM to 3 PM on weekdays, their lunch buffet costs $10.81 after the $1 Players card discount. This comes out to the same price point or even less of the higher priced burger chains including the Johnny Rockets that shares the same roof. For $10.81, a little more money than McDonald's I paid for a super meal that was a combination of lunch, dinner, and dessert. When you take into consideration that I ate this super meal hours before sleep time and that the lion's share of the plates were non beef, this was a quality and not quantity dining experience. In other words I did not pig out.    The two times that I dined here were on Tuesday, December 18 at 1:05 PM and December 26 at 11:23 AM. The fact that I returned here a week later is testimony to my application of it. I seem to share the same appreciation of many people considering that when it opened at 11 AM there was a 20 minute wait.    There was quite a lot for me to appreciate about Season's Buffet. Seven reasons were the seven stations featuring appetizing food. Here are the stations and some of the food items:  Mexican   Tacos with ingredients, Menudo, and Mexican shrimp cocktail.   American  Roasted corn, liver & onions, live meat including brisket and roasted turkey , baked beans, carrots, and tri-tip, smoked sausage, fried chicken, tator tarts, mashed potatoes, and chili.  Asian   Pork and shrimp fried rice, pad Tai, Chinese broccoli, sesame chicken, Spring rolls, chicken hot and sour soup, green beans, Chinese vegetables and egg drop soup   Italian   Pizza,chicken, sausage and peppers, dried ravioli, soup of the day and manicotti   Soup & Salad   Salad, lentil soup, chicken noodle soup, shrimp pasta salad, fruit salad, and artichoke salad.   Dessert  Assorted pies, assorted cakes, peanut butter brownies, lemon curd, peanut butter cupcakes, pistachio cupcakes,  Ice cream: chocolate mint, spumani, vanilla, strawberry, chocolate, and peach.    My favorite item was the shrimp pasta salad. When it is available shrimp salad is one of my favorite buffet items. And when it is available, as one of the pictures below shows, I load up on it. My second favorite item was the immense serving of brisket from the live Station. This had quality written all over it. My secondary favorites were the hot & sour soup, Pad Tai, shrimp fried rice, Chinese vegetables, roasted corn, and fried chicken. The ice cream topped off this super meal. This is the first time I recall licking peach ice cream inside a buffet.    The ambiance added to my enjoyment of eating this food. It shares the same lodge theme as the hotel. A soft lighting and laid back environment permeates the lodge theme. This theme is ideal for relaxation.    Just like many buffets there were serving challenges. On both visits my server covered a large area. I took preemptive action ordering two sodas when she arrived at my table. To free up the servers, a self serve Freestyle Coke or Pepsi fountain would be beneficial.    After two visits, I am impressed with Season's Buffet. At $10.81 after the & $1 players card discount, their weekday lunch buffet is a great deal. It is so good that it can make it difficult to be a restaurant explorer.

SNpSHFhRRG9c-Yy2HGWqrA.text: We liked this buffet a lot.  We went on a Thursday night for dinner, so it wasn't very crowded.  The buffet was on the smaller side compared to some others, but we found the selection to be good. The food isn't overly fancy, but it was hot, fresh and delicious the night we went.  We thought the mac and cheese was pretty good as was the pizza.  Our server was friendly and helpful.  We look forward to going again.

Forgot to take a pic of the dessert ... they even have Passion fruit mini cheesecake and Haupia! I suggest to get a Silverton rewards first to get a discount or free buffet! rmMP84MM0SzpQU8VyI1bhA.text: I came here because they advertise Polynesian Buffet Saturday's. I didn't like it. I'm sorry to say but there's a reason you don't see a lot of islanders eating there on Saturdays. Not much I can say, if you know, you know.

r1u8VADoerKILGIjWy60Aw.text: Wow! Must be a secret for those who knows cause the level quality and quantity in a local casino buffet is second to none! I am referring to the lobster fri nights at the Silverton Seasons Buffett! Wait was alil long , but you give them a number and they call you back so you don't stand around too long compared to some other seafood buffets.  The lobster is pretty good size and the line for the lobster is quick.  The raw oysters and ahi poki are sweet and fresh.  The service was great! My drink was never empty and my table is always clean by the time I got back!  Let me tell you about the service! The chef, George, saw the line for the dessert was piling up and he started scooping and serving customer ice cream! He even did it with a big smile on his face! Talk about leadership by example to make sure the customers are taking care of! I will definitely be coming back and bringing people!

VBJTI5pbBTG6gBpCIlhaHQ.text: A very mediocre buffet with average quality. Pricing is fair. There have been discounts availed in the past. Not as much selection as I would like.

FUYQ99EUHg2TOHMMTy7cFQ.text: Most months this buffet at the Silverton has one day a week they do BOGO. For Jan it's BOGO Thursday. Sign up for a card at the player's club and the day of the BOGO print out a coupon at the kiosk and head to the buffet. The coupon is only good for that day.  Also the same day you sign up for the player's card, play table games and earn just 50 points and you get another coupon for a free buffet to use anytime you want.  The buffet is pretty good for $9.99, then factor in the BOGO it's only $5/person. Can't beat that deal, as you can't even get full of of $5 at a fast food place.  There's Mexican food (fish tacos, menudo, pozole, or albondigas soup, ground beef tacos), carving station (roast beef, chicken or turkey, and even their skin fried, ham, grilled veggies), Italian (pizza, pasta), Asian (Pad thai or chow mein, beef and broccoli, egg rolls, Asian soups, string beans), and salad bar. Even for a picky eater, you can make yourself a nice big healthy salad and it will be worth the $5.

gQQMdqeuRw4fB9zFG6jCCg.text: So first I'd like to start out by saying that we got a free voucher for one person to get in to the buffet because of how much we gambled, we so decided one night to go with no dinner plans. We didn't know the buffet schedule and just happened to show up on a Thursday night which was a seafood night, we thought we were in for a treat. Of course I had to pay to get in because my boyfriend was the one with the free voucher. $30.99. Considering it was seafood night that's pretty decently priced I thought. However when we got in there and looked at the selection, we couldn't believe how SMALL the buffet is. And how SMALL the crab legs were. We grabbed our first (and only round) of food and sat down. I realized I hadn't seen anything to cut the crab legs with and asked my server, who pointed me back the crab legs. I went back, seen nothing, and asked one of the cooks where I could find one. He said my server would bring me one. Great. I told him I was pointed here and he went and got me one. Again, small crab legs, the steak was fatty and over cooked, corn was soggy, just about the only thing we liked was the mashed potatoes and mac and cheese. And other than these items they had pizza, chicken, and fries. What a selection! Also, the desert looked like it had been sitting out for hours and tasted like it too. One thing that really got me down was they didn't have those ice cream machines that typical buffets do. Their selection was awful and basically so was the food. I've never been to a buffet and gotten one plate of food for both dinner and dessert and been so disappointed. Never again.

BrAfTPR74VBihXaCoANSfw.text: This is the first time eating here and it was not bad at all. The Salad was kind of old but it did have variety of dishes with free champagne and some drinks. Sunrise was good as well. Nice upgraded decor as well. Will come back again.

th8jDpx9mrTL3alGDBtfrw.text: The buffet was ok better than a lot.. not as good as some! The mimosas were good just the regular mimosas don't try any of the flavored ones they were to sweet with the syrup they added. The food was decent. The staff was friendly. Probably would not be back! Just a little to pricey for what you got.

3cBwbRw_Mob3y52J3H_jZA.text: It was a nice surprise to find this hidden gem on our way to Death Valley. First off the place is very reasonably priced. Convenient parking. The roomy dinning space is not filled with 2nd smoke. Dessert is absolutely delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A61aPH39FgZk-DuJeN0jnA.text: We were in Vegas for CES - staying at the Silverton - joining their gambling club enabled a 10% off + on thursdays you get an additional 2 for 1 deal.  Aside from that - the fare was slightly less varied but of good quality and presentation.  But let's not be fooled into thinking it is spectacular.  I gave 3 stars for being a good deal - and good grub!  Realy it is A-OK!

k06DoITwnl1L-5yOzU4rIw.text: Wow. I had a buy one get one free from here and I still felt like I wanted my money back. This place is best suited for chainsmoking, walkers with tennis ball,  Ben gay smothered geriatrics. You'd get better food at Sizzler. So, heads up, SKIP IT. If you find yourself at this spot and you HAVE to eat, Go to the cafe. It's much, much better!

6KIYZL4CLTzPpctrQInK8w.text: Top 3 buffets in town for sure. From the service to the salad dressings to the desserts. The sugar free cheesecake is out of this world. We have bought entire cheesecake to take home it's so good !

AkcwuwF-uAMUprC1AwGZJQ.text: Mediocre at best. Most food was dried out and sitting under the heat lamps too long. Glad my experience was free- from a club promotion I earned in July. I wouldn't go again. Salad bar was the best part. Spinach and strawberry salad was the highlight. Desert ok. Most signs did not match food.  For example: The "fried chicken" was roasted and dried out. Fried pot stickers were steamed.   Drinks were so slow. I had two cokes. I was by myself. And it took 15+ minutes for my first one. I already had eaten most of my salad before it came.   Very minimal offerings. Pasta bar (dry dry dry). What I assume was supposed to be Asian bar. Had lemon chicken, spring roll, dry noodle, etc. Prime rib was tough.   Just not impressed. Small and dinky. Blah service. Dry food. I went on Friday August 22, 2014.

X9wi2CbWybJRSU5h9irdqg.text: We have been to Silverton's buffet several times now.  We were very impressed the first time, which was a Saturday night.  But our review has gone downhill since then; I believe our visits since have been on Sunday nights.  The Stations are hands-down much much better.  Because the Stations get so many more people, they have much more of a selection and the food is much fresher and of better quality.  Everything was just okay with some things better and some worse.  The chicken noodle soup was good, and nice and hot, not always the case with buffets.  Salad toppings very minimal.  The grilled veggies were very good; my husband was very disappointed with the pizza which looked good, but the crust which looked pretty thin, was not crunchy.  The supposed 'rice pilaf' had no pilaf, just dried rice and some awful spice.  Went back up and took a stuffed cabbage figuring I couldn't go wrong; tasted like it was covered in ketchup.  Desserts very so-so.  Rice crispy treat had no flavor--how do you mess that up.  Soda completely flat; couldn't tell if it was pepsi or coke; maybe it was neither.  They don't use the paper placemats which I actually like because I know it is pretty clean.  Only give you one fork.  Service is good.  Overall disappointed.

p4DjOAlEC6jB-kKn2oNsMQ.text: Went here for brunch last Saturday.  For a buffet it wasn't bad.  A little pricey but not bad.  The beverage server was on the mark - our cups were never empty of coffee. Unlimited Samosas were included which was great - and I am not a frequent drinker but I did have one Saturday.  Good amount of food to choose from and everything tasted good.  Nothing really to complain about.  Not top notch but worth a revisit.

iClM39vuILQIt28LyDX-RA.text: Today I came here to get their free Veterans Day buffet. I got there early, but just as they were to open they informed the crowd that to get the free Veterans Day buffet veterans would also have to show a freaking players club card. So I had to get out of line and get a card. The players club card requirement is NOWHERE on any signage or adds I have seen. South Point and The Station casinos don't require this. Very uncool.

0cx9bx5BrhEY8d_BQRhhng.text: After reading reviews I decided to come here and I was totally disappointed. The only reason this place is 2 stars Vs 1 star is the very polite, make your own, pasta chef. All the food was very bland and the prime rib was dry and tasteless. For the price it is a decent bargain but I would rather spend some more money for better quality of food. The only thing that was tasty was a potsticker I had otherwise there was nothing to even discuss.

photos.caption: Photo of Seasons Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everything was dry and not tasty even the Rice Krispy treats

XDIfzV-Wu_T5uRh7QKkirQ.text: This buffet has an upscale club feel with a very attractive decor and soft lighting. Tables, floors, and counters were clean and actively kept clean while I was there for lunch. Foods are mainstream items and are presented in a visually-appealing manner. There were Mexican specialty foods. Variety of selections for lunch is average. All foods I tasted were very good. Service was very good. The buffet was somewhat quiet and filled with many senior customers. My server said the lunch menu varies during the week. The room looks completely filled at dinner and weekend brunches. The specialty dinner nights especially have a full house and long entrance lines. While this buffet may not have the size or grandeur of the larger strip buffets, the quality of the surroundings, competence of the operation, prices, and good food make it an excellent value.

9s6lrJmURNUjBDFNEvHXAw.text: Great place to eat simple and clean always fresh foodexcept Mondays is way to busy to enjoy.... Seems like they bus the gray hair in then got to fight it out inside ......!any other day easy to get

m_S0fgpTVqTRHkhv8hr66A.text: My family came here for the Sunday Brunch.  It was approximately 1:30 p.m. when we got there.  We definitely were not impressed with their offerings.  The pizza looked like it has been sitting out.  Got some chow fun from the asian offerings.  It was cold.  Tried some of their sushi.  It was terrible.  Sadly the best thing I had was the mashed potatoes.  Those were hot and fresh.  When we were leaving the buffet my husband got immediately sick.  Won't be returning!

1KhtpJWY__FzkaOuks_3sA.text: Sign up for the rewards card to save a buck or 2. We went for dinner tonight (thursday) dinner for 2 was 30$, not to bad. Compared to GVR'S Feast Buffet this one was amazing. Their food actually had seasonings and seemed to be a much better quality. The Orange Chicken was really good and they have seasoned vegy. They were my favorite, the perfect seasoning on them. Omgosh yum. Our waiter was really nice and was on top of the drinks. We will definitely be coming back and bringing guests when they visit!

tYzPeLrmDnXWTGlV_aWHnA.text: We went on a Wednesday night. It was very good. I had a salad, prime rib, pulled pork, Mac n cheese, watermelon, & pizza. They had Asian inspired flavoring on some green beans which was awesome!  Our booth was old sand had saggy cushions & I felt like I was sinking. That's kind of annoyed me a little throughout the meal. A server told us there was no steak knives & a different server found us some, that was some what bother some. All in all I liked the food selections & it tasted good.

aQoPmkslVtztSVbDe2Agaw.text: Food was great, went there with 4 other people and everyone enjoyed their meal. The salmon was amazing and the desserts were delicious. Also, loved the mac and cheese. The price is very reasonable for what you get.

mrkMdQvwL4gGQGlnForvCw.text: Wow!!!I loved the decor and the food was so good.....price was right (( we had gotten the discount...)) I LIKED the Roasted Brisket,it was perfectly seasoned and tender ....melt in your mouth good....In the Italian section,. they had this bone less skin less chicken in a thick white cream garlic sauce....and it was very rich....and cheesy.....I was in awe of it.....and the whole roasted garlic that you squeeze out of the skin sleeve and spread on a soft fresh baked bread,,,,yummm,,,,I even squeezed the fresh roasted garlic onto the garlic,cheezy cream sauced chicken too.....for dessert, I had a piece of boysenberry pie with a scoop of their homemade french vanilla ice cream....I really liked the set up.... a wood pole with water running down the length and fire running up it....awesome....and 15 frames with moving pictures of sunsets... waves crashing leaves blowing from frame to frame to frame.....I had never seen anything like it.....so beautiful....Back to the food..... there were so many different types of food it was amazing.....I stuck to what I liked and did not try it all....but Next trip to sin city.....I'm there!!! lol.....

5ibmP_qdg2dLiOxg6Y3FwQ.text: it's okay.. the thing about buffets is that i get really full too fast..... coma status usually, so being able to try everything is impossible.   they have a really good dessert selection.... breakfast, mexican, seafood, salad bar of course...... and your meats and potatoes section.   it's ok.  not the best.

0N1uQk8Oo2Qx773d3qo4XA.text: We went there on a weekday right around noon. There were only about 30 people ahead of us and we waited in line. They only had ONE cashier for both the VIP line and the regular line. Every minute or so another senior folk with a VIP card would come in and she would take them before taking us. After an hour it was finally our turn, the clerk asked us how many people were in our party and proceeded to ask us if we had a players card and if we wanted to sign up for one...then started making small talk. REALLY?! If I wanted a player's card, I would have waited in the player's card line. I was so irritated because she was taking her sweet time. Don't mess with hungry folks. As soon as we passed the cashier, it was all smooth sailing. The food is not bad and neither is the service once you're in. The place itself is gorgeous. But as I looked around, I was so mad at the cashier because there were so many empty tables, and SHE was the bottleneck.

R2MlhdAlTmmn5T2c735ZrQ.text: Ok when you can't afford the expensive buffets on the Strip you tend to settle for something less expensive...or free, that's where Seasons comes into play. Sign up for their players club and receive a free buffet but expect the buffet line to be long and I mean long. Yes it took us almost an hour to get through the line and they without a doubt were understaffed. I was worried that my food partner was going to pass out due to low blood sugar. Finally we were seated and rushed to the buffet line. Overall I must say that this buffet wasn't too shabby. Most of their food was actually pretty good. The prime was was great for being buffet prime rib. This sucker was huge, I didn't know the actual prime rib could come in dinosaur size! The desserts were ok, by the time I actually got to dessert they were already cleaning up the stations. Overall for a buffet, this is a pretty decent buffet. They could staff it better especially since they give away free buffets. Try it for yourself when you can't decide on what to eat!

hYuzVDE069fgn87QpMachA.text: Oh Boy...I'm taking such a leap by writing a public review on the Silverton Brunch. You know you are my peeps when I let you in on the Silverton. So here we go...here are the reasons why the Seasons Buffet is awesome on a Sunday: 1. Hardly a line....everyone is at the strip which is so not the place to be, and look at me and my girls....3 people ahead of us...we are so close to crabs it's not even funny and I'm not just saying that because we are leaving Vegas. 2. Large round tables! Yes! I hate having to sit at square tables where you can't hear what is going on at the end and you have to go on a scavenger hunt to find the ketchup. These tables are huge and me and my girls can get to business which involves sharing photos, memories and mimosas. 3. CRAB! What the hell happened on the strip? I went to the buffet at the Bellagio for Sunday brunch and there was no crab! Are you joking? Whatev...we are at the Silverton, so pile it on.  4. No rush! The friendly servers at the Silverton want you to sit down and stay awhile. No one pushing you out or frowning when you take obnoxious group photos. 5. When you are done eating you are steps away from the BASS PRO SHOP! Hello? Are we out of mace? It is a long trip home....we may need to check out the tents in case we get stuck somewhere....wait...are those stuffed wildlife? Who doesn't love stuffed wildlife? And the Gun selection! Wow! Well, you can definitely spend hours in the Bass Pro Shop that's for sure. Last time we left I ended up with a bottle of water, a pack of red vines and a giant stuffed Jackalope that we fondly named "J-Lope" and yes, she was so big she needed a seat belt. LOVE IT!

q9lE_y_nzAWHlL0LR1mRiQ.text: Sunday Champagne Brunch was okay. The food was so-so; nothing spectacular and nothing rememberable. Drink as much champagne as you are willing to get up to get. They will not serve you alcohol at your table.

yloFYatWw4FX2_vKn49Kgw.text: My wife and I went on BBQ night. We were surprised to find there was not much BBQ to be found. So.e chicken and maybe some kind of pulled pork. We were not impressed, especially for the price. We will not be returning.

BTVLaLqRKkVC_TNGqmmqVQ.text: The below review represents only the opinion of the reviewer and may not be factually accurate. You should try it, and decide for yourself.   No. No. No. No. I don't think so my friendly friends.   They messed up with me and there is no going back to the time when I held the Buffet at the Silverton in high regard.   Here you go:   Waffles not good.  No butter or whipped cream or fresh strawberry to go on waffles.  Only cheap nasty strawberry giz goo stuff.  French toast was some weird deep fried crap with oatmeal on the outside.   The fruit spread was just 2 bowls. One watermelon and one other melon cut into crude chunks is a $20 brunch... there should be beautifully sliced fruit... not disgusting hunks of fruit put in a bowl.)  The orange juice had a bizarre Tang like flavor to it.  We got up for 3 minutes after having only been there for 15 and when we came back they had cleared our table. How nice.   While the manager was a super nice lady the guy serving was below par. He was having a hard time doing the damn thing.   There has got to be much better out there. Take a drive over to the Red Rock casino... they have a great breakfast.

yKn8bIoJZh7l_6b-S73_Ig.text: Why on earth was I even AT the silverton buffet?  Well, cuz my dad wanted to get his $5 senior buffet on, that's why.  Otherwise I'm sure I wouldn't have gone in.  I've been to so many bad buffets at the locals hotels, I'm always leary.  But for a cheap buffet, the food was ok.  The prime rib was pretty good and they had some pretty tasty grilled veggies.  Oh and the German Chocolate cake was ok.   On the other hand, the mushy egg rolls and funky dried out cinnamon muffins were inedible.  And our service was horrible.  Our waitress was EXTREMELY slow... and I mean that both physically and mentally.  We asked for sodas for our group 4-5 separate times and she NEVER go them right.  Two diets, two rootbeers and two Sierra Mists.  Is that really THAT hard?  What's worse is it seemed like she couldn't have cared any less that she kept bringing us the wrong drinks.  She would just shrug and take the wrong ones over to another table.  Pretty lame.  Overall, I would add this to my list of places to eat only if you have some kind of seriously great coupon and you just want to get lots of food into your stomach for cheap.  If you're looking for great quality and good service.... keep looking.

NvGEIIc3nLirXAjRPNt50w.text: We got a $75 free dinner coupon so we went.  Thanks so much it was free.    -food was not hot. -buffet area was not very clean considered we went it as it opened at 4:00pm. -the quality and the taste were just meh... -not a lot of option.  My husband got the $5 all you can drink wine/beer/cocktail though, I guess it was what worth...  It was funny that that evening we came home, we got another free dinner at seasons buffet again, I don't think we would go though even it was free so now you know how bad it was...

z1oBf83psuUbguY04gwYcg.text: It's definitely lacking a lot not the best in vegas but not the worst. Needs to step it up it's not even a 3 star buffet it's really more of a 2 star buffet food is not even close to any of the others

IN3S6iz2c4Z5QgGMhdBgMg.text: either I was hungry or this place is really good. All the food I had was perfect , the egg rolls where crisp , the steak they served was tender , the pad thai wasn't too spicy and all you can drink wine for $5 . I only paid 10.99 which is not bad , I usually would pay more at a nasty denny's .

639btWxFrxwcxyOwLOXNcA.text: Had better buffets! Luckily this was free! My friend got a coupon in the mail and he invited me to come, my guess it is Hawaiian nite, being that there were many Hawaiian dishes, food was just okay but the most worrisome thing was that there are no dedicated serving utensils for each dish, and you have to use the same utensil for serving multiple items, I have a allergy to shrimp, and at the pasta area, the lady used the same spoon to ladle each ingredient, they have shrimp and clams to make pasta and the same spoon was used for garlic, cheese, onions etc , I told her I had allergies and she said it was fine, and continued making my dish, after 1 taste my mouth became itchy and irratated! My allergy is not as bad as some people's , so I have to wonder how many people they have injured or made sick due to this lack of basic food safety techniques??? If u have any allergies I would highly recommend staying away from here! Such a shame, you can tell they spent alot of money on decor ,because it is very nicely decorated but , I think they should have spent the money teaching their employees basic food safety !! Well I'm off to get some , benedryll!! Be warned!!

Mpjeul4VXZvOQWj8LA0HxA.text: I haven't been here in years. I went tonight and I thought everything was good on BBQ night. Prime Rib was excellent.

HNk8WUQO_7yDX9LIDVTjPA.text: Disgusting.  Over cooked, dry, tough ribs. Frozen and wilted vegetables.  YUCK! NOT WORTH the $.

qTK_2dhBqv3IGsyQ3VM-8Q.text: My favorite part of Vegas is the trip home. It has slowly become a tradition to eat here on the way out of Las Vegas. Although our whole group of girls loves this place, I am probably the only one who looks forward to leaving more than anything else for two very delicous words: crab legs.  The one thing I have spent my buffet eating trips loving is shrimp and cocktail sauce. Especially when there horseradish standing by. Now although I am still quite enamored with them, I think I have found my buffet soulmate in crab legs. Simply amazing. I am lucky enough to have a Tina Z. in my life who used to work at Red Lobster and has taught me the kung fu art that is extracting crab meat from the shells, but you'll figure it out. Trust me. Hot or cold. With or without fatty butter. I am starving just thinking about them and a little sad that I don't have my next trip out there planned yet.   Anyway, for those who don't obsess like me, the rest of the buffet is also excellent. Waffles with strawberry topping or funky french toast covered in crunchy oat things. Pizza with a side of full roasted garlic heads (you read that right, not cloves, heads). Oh and my other weird obsession, bagles with smoked salmon and cream cheese. So good. The dessert bar is also pretty amazing. I fell deeply in love with their coffee flavored flan of some sort. And many flavors of ice cream! Blueberry pie! Man it's a good thing they're located in a different state beacuse I don't have the time to go to as many TKB classes as it would take to burn off these calories.  Oooh and the mimosa bar. Not sure if it's an everyday thing, but on Sunday there's a mimosa bar in which you can have champagne and pureed orange, mango, white peach, and a couple of other flavors. By Sunday alcohol is not usually on my list of what I want to drink, but I have started to try a glass here or there.  Whenever you can find the time to fit this place into your Vegas trip, make it happen. Oh and you'll only spend ~$20 for a Sunday burnch. So worth it.

nMtM7fby88sNThdfJIuVlw.text: Came here twice, everything was nasty. orange juice tasted like fake medicine flavor, ordered coffee, and it came in a big mug with lipstick marks and coffee stains on it, rice crispy smelled and tasted like smoky BBQ flavor, Ice cream tasted like medicine. never again.
